She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a farmer) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their four children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to help her to purchase more rice for resale.

loans.name: Majed

texts.en:
A 47-year-old married father of four, Majed is from Iraq where he and two of his children provide the family's income. Majed owns a small shop that specializes in tailoring men's wear. He also sells all types of textiles in demand. In business since 1992 and now employing one other person, he has gained much experience in this field along with the respect of his community.

Majed is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD to pay the annual rent of his shop. This loan will help him to grow his business and increase his profits and give him the ability to continue to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop

loans.name: Bayan

texts.en: Bayan is a 22-year-old, single lady, who lives with her parents and eight siblings. Bayan is a university student who wants to support her parents in their business, from which they are paying the household bills. They have a few sheep and goats, and they sell animals from time to time. They also sell milk, which is used to make dairy products, including cheese and yogurt. Bayan is applying for a Youth Loan, which she will use to obtain more goats. The additional animals will enable the family to increase their profits from selling milk.

loans.use: to obtain more goats

loans.name: Angella

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 40-year-old Angella from Harare. She is married with four children, three attending school. Angella runs a retail business where she sells cellphones, accessories, and blankets. The business has been in operation for 10 years. She says the main challenge being faced is lack of capital. Angella has requested a loan of $700 to buy more cellphones, accessories and blankets for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable her to pay school fees for her children going to school. In the future Angella plans to build her own shop.

loans.use: to buy cellphones and accessories and blankets for resale.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a small-scale seamstress who also sells eggs in Adenic Ro (near Cape Coast). She has had some form of formal education as she is a junior high school graduate. She is married and has 1 child. Her husband is a photographer. Monica has been working as a seamstress and egg seller for close to 3 years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their child’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of sewing supplies and eggs, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a seamstress stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of sewing supplies and eggs.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Although she grew up in difficult circumstances, Martha is an entrepreneur. She specializes in hair dressing in Adenic Ro (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 2 years. Martha is single without any children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her support herself and her extended family. Martha wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels of hair products, hence allowing her to style more hair. In the long term, Martha plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels of hair products, hence allowing her to style more hair.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Adjoa is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling foodstuffs and fish in Bukuruso (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 10 years. Adjoa is married and has 2 children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Adjoa wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of foodstuff and fish. In the long term, Adjoa plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of foodstuffs and fish.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Efua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling fish, in Bukuruso (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 10 years. Efua is married and has five children. Her husband is currently retired. Because she is the sole breadwinner in the family, the proceeds from her business normally go towards covering the entire family’s general expenses.

Efua wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fish. In the long term, Efua plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fish

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca sells palm oil and rice, in Bukuruso (near Cape Coast). She was educated until the end of junior high school.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. Rebecca has been working in her palm oil and rice enterprise for 20 years. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees.

Rebecca will use her loan to increase her current stock levels. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her palm oil and rice enterprise and to increase her capital base. In the long run, she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of palm oil and rice she has in stock

loans.name: Sarith

texts.es: Sarith, de 24 años de edad , vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en su casa propia.El trabajo de Sarith consiste en la venta de mercadearía, específicamente en la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros tales como pantalones , polos , blusas , entre otros.Por las mañanas ella se dedica a las actividades del hogar pero por las tardes sale a buscar a sus clientes, entre ellos están sus amigos, vecinos y algunos familiares. Lleva trabajando en esta actividad 4 años el cual lo realiza sola además que le gusta su trabajo por que le brinda buenos ingresos ecónomicos.Este será su segundo préstamo con Kiva, y se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero recibido para continuar con su trabajo.Con el monto solicitado de 1200 soles comprará polos, pantalones, camisas, blusas, entre otros.
texts.en: Sarith, age 24, lives with her husband and two children in her own home. Sarith sells clothing such as pants, polos, and shirts for men and women. In the mornings, she takes care of the house, but in the afternoons she goes out to her clients who include her friends, neighbours, and some family members. She has had this business for four years and works alone. She likes her work because it provides her with a good income. This will be her second loan on Kiva. She is very grateful for the financial support in continuing with her work. With the requested 1200 soles, she will buy polos, pants, shirts, blouses, and other items.

loans.use: to buy polos, pants, shirts, blouses, and other items.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is divorced and has three children. After successfully graduating Junior High School, Joyce  is now an established businesswoman. She sells doughnuts in Adenic Ro (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about nine years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Joyce  uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Joyce  will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of flour, sugar, and cooking oil, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Joyce  plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customers preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of flour, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a small scale doughnut seller in Adenic Ro (near Cape Coast). She has had some form of formal education as she is a Junior High School graduate. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a machine operator. Mercy has been working as a doughnut seller for close to 10 years. 

Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of flour, sugar, and cooking oil, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of doughnuts. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to develop her business further and ensure that all her children receive an education

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of flour, sugar, and cooking oil, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of doughnuts.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: After graduating primary school, Ama decided to set up her own ‘wakye’ selling business (wakye is a traditional Ghanaian dish made primarily from beans, rice and colored leaves). She prepares her wakye on her own and proceeds to sell it in Bukuruso (near Cape Coast). With over 10 years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more rice and beans, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty wakye. She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a farmer) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their 4 children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to help her purchase more rice and beans, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty wakye.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Efua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling fish in Bukuruso (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 4 years. Efua is married and has 6 children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Efua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of fish, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fish to sell.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba is a small-scale beverage seller in Bukuruso (near Cape Coast). She has had some form of formal education as she is a junior high school graduate. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Araba has been working as a beverage seller for close to 7 years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of drinks, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a beverage stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of drinks, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demands.

loans.name: Zina

texts.en: Zina is a 40-year-old woman. She works in selling cosmetics, blankets and clothing items to make a living. After the winter season was over she was left with few cosmetic products to sell. She wants to increase the quantity she has by bringing a new summer collection of female clothing items and new bed cover sets for single and double sized beds. For that she has applied to this loan.

loans.use: to bring a new summer collection of female clothing items and new bed cover sets for single and double sized beds.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is a widow and has 5 children. After successfully graduating middle school, Hannah is now an established businesswoman. She sells rice and yams in Adenic Ro (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about 27 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Hannah uses her income to provide for the entire family. Hannah will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of rice and yams, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hannah plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of rice and yams.

loans.name: Felix  Pedro

texts.es:
Don Félix dice que su  crédito anterior le ayudo para darle mantenimiento y manejo agronómico a cuatro manzanas de café logrando cosechar  variedades tales como; bourbon y catuai y obtener buenos rendimientos de producción. Cabe señalar que a pesar que los rendimientos del café fueron aceptables. El precio de comercialización de este producto estuvo muy bajo debido a las fluctuaciones del precio en el mercado internacional pero logro sacar los costos de producción y pagar el crédito.
Este nuevo crédito lo  piensa invertir en compra de insumos agrícola como abonos, fertilizantes y gastos de mano de obra Para darle mantenimiento a cuatro manzanas de café. El desea en  lo futuro comprar más parcelas de café y así aumentar la producción. Una vez finalizado el pago de este crédito su siguiente paso sería renovar una manzana de café.
texts.en:
Don Félix says that his previous loan helped him to maintain his seven acres of coffee crops. He was able to harvest varieties such as bourbon and catuai, and made a good income from the production. Even though the harvest was good, the price of the product was very low due to international market price fluctuations, but he was able to cover production costs and repay the loan.
He plans to invest this new loan in the purchase of agricultural supplies such as manure and fertilizer, and to pay the labourers to maintain his seven acres of coffee crops. In the future he wants to buy more land in order to increase production. Once this loan is repaid, his next step will be to renew two acres of land.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer, and to pay labourers.

loans.name: Rosa A. Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias una de ellas es Rosa Amelia mujer de 44 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos de 17 y 21 años de edad, tiene cuatro años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa nueva y destace de cerdos y venta de nacatamal. Anteriormente solamente se dedicaba a la venta de ropa lo cual ha diversificado su actividad con la inversión de sus ganancias. Su hijo mayor le ayuda en el negocio. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de pantalón de varón, pantalón de mujer, camisas de damas, camisas de varón, camisetas, trajes de niños, trajes de niñas y la compra de cerdo en pie. Con el crédito anterior aumento sus inventarios en la inversión de prendas con Zafiro, productos cosméticos de la Zermat este lo vende de contado invirtió en sandalias ella tiene 18 meses de ser cliente de la institución. Mariela tiene 30 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y Fabiola tiene 30 años de edad y su negocio es la venta ropa nueva y zapatos.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three members, one of whom is Rosa Amelia. She is a 44-year-old woman, married with two children ages 17 and 21. She has sold new clothing, raised hogs, and sold nactamales [tamales] for four years. Previously she only sold clothing, but she has diversified her activities by investing her income. Her eldest child helps her with the business. She will invest this loan in the purchase of men's and women's pants, men's and women's shirts, t-shirts, boys' and girls' clothing, and for the purchase of a live hog.
With her previous loan she expanded her inventory by investing in Zafiro-brand clothing and Zermat cosmetics. She sells her items for cash. She will invest in the purchase of sandals. She has been a client of the institution for 18 months.
Mariela is 30 and sells new clothing. Fabiola is 30 and sells new clothing and shoes.

loans.use: to buy new clothing such as men's and women's pants, shirts, t-shirts, children's clothing, and to buy a hog.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo aged 28 years, is a married woman.  She has five children, three of whom attend school. Kadzo owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Kadzo has operated a fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other fish sellers in her business.
 
With the Kshs 20,000 loan she will purchase bundles of fish to resell. She decided to join Kiva partner Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish to resell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances Ama did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Ama sells oil in Bukuruso (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 4 years. Her husband purchases goods for a corporation and together they have 4 children. Ama uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Ama will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of oil, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Ama wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of oil.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: After graduating junior high school, Ama decided to set up her own general store in Adenic Ro (near Cape Coast). With over 8 years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more onions, utensils, soaps and other items for resale. She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a trader) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their 2 children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to help her  purchase more onions, utensils, soaps and other items for resale.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Ekua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling doughnus and bread in Bukuruso (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 10 years. Ekua is married and has Bukuruso. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children's school fees. Ekua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of flour, sugar, and other ingredients, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of flour, sugar, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is married with one child. She has received some schooling till the end of junior high school. Currently, Esi sells kooko (porridge) in Bukuruso (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this industry for about 5 years now. Her husband is an accountant. Esi’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. Esi will use the loan to increase her existing kooko-making capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Esi plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing porridge-making capacity.

loans.name: Gladys Cecilia

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Gladys quien con su anterior credikiva logró comprar una máquina y materias primas con lo cual aumentó la calidad de sus prendas y la producción de cubrelechos, sabanas, fundas y en general ropa de camas.  Sus ventas se incrementaron, sus  ganancias también y por eso ha comprado artículos para su hogar. Muchas gracias y que nos sigan ayudando para progresar en nuestro negocio. El nuevo crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materias primas para elaborar las sabanas y cubrelechos y ropa para damas e infantil.
texts.en: Thank you for supporting Gladys, who used her previous loan on Kiva to buy a sewing machine and basic supplies with which she increased the quality of her products. She also increased her production of sheets, bedspreads, pillowcases, and general bedclothes. Her sales increased, as did her income, so she bought items for her home. Thank you very much and please continue to support this business' growth. She will invest this loan in the purchase of basic supplies for making sheets, bedspreads, and women's and children's clothing.

loans.use: to buy basic materials for making sheets, bedspreads, and clothing for women and children.

loans.name: Las Uvas Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por cinco socias emprendedoras una de ellas es María es una mujer de 35 años , casada, desde hace 10 años vende carne de cerdo y producto de comida derivado del cerdo como el frito, chicharrón, cabeza de chancho, su hermana le ayuda en el negocio tiene de ser clientes de la institución siete años ha demostrado ser clientes buena paga, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de carne de cerdo como posta, costillas, cabeza del cerdo, en el crédito anterior logro aumentar sus productos en la venta de sopa los fines de semanas, Karen tiene 30 años de edad y su negocio es una pulpería en su domicilio, Susana tiene 31 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de verduras, queso, crema ambulante en una camioneta con su esposo, Angela tiene 49 años de edad su negocio venta de ropa nueva, gaseosas variadas, cosméticos de la Avon y recargas electrónicas de celulares y Jacqueline tiene 32 años de edad y su negocio es la hecha y venta tortilla y ropa nueva.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of five enterprising members. One of these members is Maria, a 35-year-old married woman. For the past 10 years, she has sold pig meat and food products such as fried meat, pork rinds, and pig heads. Her sister helps her with the business. She has been a client of the institution for seven years and has demonstrated herself as making good payments. She will invest the loan into buying pig meat such as pork, ribs, and heads. From her previous loan, she was able to increase her products to sell soup on the weekends.

Karen, 30 years old, has a small convenience store business. Susana, 31, sells vegetables, cheese, and cream by driving in a truck with her husband. Angela, 49, sells new clothing, soft drinks, Avon cosmetics, and cell phone chargers. Jacqueline, 32, makes and sells tortillas and clothing.

loans.use: to buy pig meat, including pork, ribs, and heads

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia, de 52 años de edad es una mujer muy alegre, amable y emprendedora. Vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo porque sus hijos ya son independientes y viven en otros lugares.El trabajo de Virginia consiste  en la preparación de comidas regionales en el frontis de su hogar. Lleva 6 años en este negocio el cual empezó con la ayuda de su esposo.Le gusta su trabajo porque le genera buenas ganancias  y claro la satisfacción de sus clientes por el buen sabor que tienen sus preparados.Hace un tiempo sufrió un robo y en este se llevaron casi todo lo que había conseguido con tanto esfuerzo y trabajo pero tomó la decisión de empezar de nuevo y le esta yendo  muy bien ya que la clientela ha ido aumentando y está saliendo adelante. Tiene pensado acrecentar su negocio y conseguir un local propio.Con el monto solicitado de 2000 soles, comprará platos, cucharas, ollas, y víveres arroz, hojas de bijao, pescado, plátano, etc. Para preparar sus deliciosos  platos regionales.
texts.en:
Virginia, age 52, is a very happy, kind, and enterprising women. She lives in a rented home with her husband because her children are now independent and live elsewhere. Virginia prepares local foods and sells them from the front of her home. She has had this business for six years, and started it with her husband's help. She enjoys her work because it generates her a good income. She enjoys seeing her customers' satisfaction at the good flavour of her dishes. Some time ago she was the victim of a robbery. They took almost everything that she had worked so hard for, but she decided to start again. It is going very well for her; her clientele has increased and she is getting ahead.
She plans to expand her business and buy her own location. With the requested 2000 soles, she will buy plates, forks, pots, and groceries (rice, bijao leaves, fish, bananas, etc) to prepare her delicious regional dishes.

loans.use: to buy plates, forks, pots, and other items for preparing her food.

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en: Nisreen is a 23-year-old married lady. She has no children yet. To help in improving their living conditions, she recently started selling blankets. It helped a lot during winter, but since the weather is getting warmer now, demand is lower for blankets. She decided to bring in lighter bedcovers to keep the business going during the summer season, too. For that reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to bring in lighter bedcovers to keep the business going during the summer season.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Even though Araba grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Araba is an entrepreneur. She sells plantains in Bukuruso (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 15 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their five children. 

Araba has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more plantains to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Araba wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more plantains to sell.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is divorced and has five children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Efua is a successful businesswoman. She sells plantains in Bukuruso (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about eight years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Efua uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Efua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of plantains, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to further diversify the types of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of plantains.

loans.name: Phyilice

texts.en:
Phyilice is 46 years old, a widow from Serem area in Kakamega county, and a mother of three children who are 22, 19 and 13 years old.

She is a farmer and grows tea on her small piece of land. Phyilice has been doing this for the last three years and makes a monthly income of KES 11,420. She has applied for a third loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase pesticides for her farm produce. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her tea farming.

Phyilice is hoping to expand the business and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Adjoa is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling plantains and fish in Bukuruso (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for five years. Adjoa is married and has three children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

She wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of plantains and fish. In the long term, Adjoa plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Yokub
loans.use: To repair his minibus, which is the source of his income

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric sells refrigerators and stoves in Bukuruso (near Cape Coast). He has been educated through Primary School.  He is married and has eight children. His wife is currently unemployed. Eric has been working in this enterprise for eight years now. As the sole provider in the family, he is responsible for paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. His loan will be used to increase his current stock levels. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to grow his refrigerator and stove enterprise and increase his capital base. In the long run, he wants to expand his business into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to increase his current stock levels

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann, now 35 years of age, used her previous loan to buy more stock of braids, hair chemicals and shampoo for use in her salon business. It was profitable and she was able to pay back the whole loan amount.

Besides the salon business, Ann runs a retail business that she has been operating for the past three years. She would like to use this loan to buy more stock of goods to sell in her retail shop. These include sugar, flour, bread, detergents and cooking fat, among other items.

She hopes to grow her business and open a wholesale shop, make more income and be able to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, bread and cooking fat to sell.

loans.name: Ameeneh

texts.en: Ameeneh is a 51-year-old widow who still has three single sons living with her. To be able to support herself and the family, Ameeneh sells clothes from home and does some sewing work using her old sewing machine. She now wants to buy a new sewing machine and a summer collection of clothes to increase her profits. For that reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes to sell and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Fenik

texts.en:
Fenik is 62 years old. She lives in Ddmashen village, which is in the Gegharkunik region, with her husband. She has two sons and a daughter. They are all married and live separately from their parents with their own families. 

Fenik and her husband are retired and for a long time they have been engaged in farming and agriculture. Fenik’s husband is engaged in bee keeping. On their farm, they have two cows, a heifer, two calves, four sheep, ten chickens and twelve beehives. The products from their agricultural business Fenik and her husband sell in the Sevan food markets. As Fenik said, she is very happy that she can sustain her family with her income from agriculture.
 
Fenik is taking a loan from Kiva for the first time and she needs 600.000 Armenian drams to buy potato seeds, fodder for her animals and wax paper for bee families. With this loan, she hopes to receive a good profit.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds, fodder for her animals and wax paper for her bee families

loans.name: Anar

texts.en:
Anar is 33 years old and married. He has two children, an 8-year-old son and a 5-year-old son. Anar has been an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fuzuli. Now he lives in the Fuzuli region, which is close to the occupied border, with his family. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income. His sons are going to preschool and primary school. Anar wants his sons to be a doctors. 

Anar started his taxi-driving business three years ago. Now he needs a 1,500 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) loan to buy car wheels because his car has broken down. He is thankful to Komak Credit Union and Kiva for supporting him. He wants to use the money from his business to help his family and to change his car. In the future, Anar wants to buy a new car because this car is old and uncomfortable for passengers. This will make his business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy car wheels

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Diana did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Diana sells kitchen utensils in Bukuruso (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 10 years. Her husband is a purchasing clerk, and together they have 4 children. Diana uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Diana will use the loan to purchase more utensils, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Diana wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase more utensils.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is a 28-year-old married man who has one child. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has a grocery store, where he sells various products. His objective is to improve his family’s standard of living and offer them better alternatives for progress. He didn`t complete his studies due to the bad situations he faced, and nobody tried to help him to continue his studying. His dad provided him enough money to establish his own grocery store. Most recently, he describes his biggest business challenge as the delay of payment from his customers. So, he is asking for a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy more grocery products to offer to his clients. In this way, he can cover the delay of payment from his customers and thereby generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products to offer to his clients.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
At the age of 32, Nazia is an energetic married woman. She has been doing a business of candle making for many years; it’s been a passion for her. She knows the method of making beautiful candles from wax, thread and other materials. She makes them in various sizes and earns enough to contribute to the family income. The immense experience in the art of candle making has lent her great versatility in making candles to meet her clients' needs. 

It’s her fourth year with Kashf Foundation, and for the improvement of her business, she requires a loan of 35,000 Pakistan rupees to buy additional materials required for making candles, such as wax and containers in various sizes and in large quantities. It would help her to inflate her sales, which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy additional materials required for making candles, such as wax and containers in various sizes and in large quantities.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 57 years old and married with four children. She runs a retail shop business in Tala town, which has been in operation for the past 10 years; it has been profitable.

This is her second loan term with KADET LTD. and she plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of goods to sell. These goods include sugar, flour, rice and cooking fat. She will use the generated profits to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to expand her shop and open a wholesale shop to make more income and be able to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is married with four children. She has received some schooling, until the end of primary school. Currently, Esi is a seamstress in Bukuruso (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this industry for about five years now. Her husband is a carpenter. Esi’s income goes toward helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. 

Esi will use the loan to increase her existing inventory. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Esi plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing inventory.

loans.name: Alizbeth

texts.en:
Ms. Alizbeth is a 46-year-old married woman; she has been doing a business of parrot sales for four years. She offers various types of parrots in various colors. Her son also assists her in selling them to the people of their community and in the local market. She makes a sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 Pakistan rupees. In this way, she would be able to purchase more varieties of parrots, such as Australian parrots, cockatiels and fishers. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of parrots, such as Australian parrots, cockatiels and fishers.

loans.name: Gogita

texts.en:
Gogita is 40 years old and lives in the Ozurgeti District of Georgia with his wife and his retired parents, who receive a pension. Gogita has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. All of his loan requests were rejected because of his family's low income and poor living conditions. 

Nowadays the family does not have a source of income except for the small monthly pension of Gogita’s parents. It is hardly enough to buy food for them and according to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the "subsistence poor" category. 

Gogita has requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business and this has now been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with favorable conditions for rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Gogita will purchase a car and serve local people as a taxi driver. This will increase the family income substantially. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car and work as a taxi driver

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Esi is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘Gari’ (a traditional Ghanaian snack that is made from starched powdered cassava). She usually sells her ‘Gari’ in Bukuruso (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling ‘Gari’ for 6 years. Esi is married and has 4 children and her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Esi wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of cassava, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty ‘Gari’. In the long term, Esi plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of cassava, thus increasing her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Nubia Aracely

texts.es: Nubia se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive en casa propia con sus padres y su hijo de 6 años de edad el estudia actualmente, ella esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en:
Nubia makes a living in farming from several years ago. This experience has given her the ability and the necessary knowledge to grow her crops. Her main planting are  corn and beans. She markets the crops in agencies of purchase-sale of basic grains that are close to her place of residence.

With the earnings from the sales, she helps with the costs of her family. She lives in her own house with her parents and her son of six years of age. She is currently studying.

She is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs that are needed such as: urea, seeds, fertilizers. As a result she expects to have better profits and continue to help with the costs of her house.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs that are needed such as: urea, seeds, fertilizers.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Ms Naseem is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of five. Her husband is a labor and her elder son is a carpenter but their income is not sufficient to cover the expenses of the household along with the educational needs of the children. That is why she started a tailoring business out of her home three years ago to contribute to the family income. She manages her household activities as well as operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. Currently, she is requesting a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons and laces in different colors. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand of her customers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Naseem hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons and laces in different colors.

loans.name: Zakran

texts.en: Ms. Zakran is a 45-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of their house. She has 20 years of experience in this field. By this time she has attained a regular list of customers and has become well known for providing good quality goods at reasonable prices. Zakran is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she has requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy packs of grains, oils and cleaning products such as soaps and detergents. In this way she would be able to cater more customers. Zakran wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy packs of grains, oils and cleaning products such as soaps and detergents.

loans.name: Misheck

texts.en:
Misheck is a 29-year-old father of two children and is married to Everline. He runs a retail shop in Oloitoktok which has been in operation for the past five years and has been profitable.
This is his first loan and he plans to use the amount to buy more stock of goods to sell. This includes sugar, rice, cooking fat, flour and detergents. He will use the generated profits to pay school fees for his children.
He hopes to grow his business and open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice, and cooking fat to sell.

loans.name: Fortune Women's Group

texts.en:
Fortune women's Group is located on the outskirts of Ibanda Town. The group comprises only women whose major activity is agriculture. They fall into different categories, including divorcees, widows, single mothers and a few who are married.

Juliet is the mother of 10 children and  a member of Fortune Women's Group. She mainly survives on small-scale agriculture and goat rearing. She also  sells charcoal. Her earnings are 200,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX). It’s through these activities that Juliet has been able to feed her 10 children, provide for their basic needs and send them to good schools. 

She has now applied for a loan of UGX 400,000 to buy goats, and will use the balance to rent some land to graze them on, since her own piece of land is small. Her main customers are neighbors and passers-by. The main challenge she faces is lack of enough land to rear her goats on. Despite all her challenges, Juliet is still a determined woman looking forward to changing her future and that of her children by giving them a good education.

loans.use: to buy goats and pay for land rental.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Abigail is an entrepreneur. She is a hairdresser in Bukuruso (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 4 years. Abigail is married and her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses. Abigail wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels of hair products, hence allowing her to style more hair. In the long term, Abigail plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels of hair products.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Ms. Shahnaz is a 33-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband. The man shown in the photo is Shahnaz’s husband. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. They have three years of experience in this field. Shahnaz is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the demands of her customers each and every time. She dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Ruqaya

texts.en: Ruqaya is a 58-year-old widow, who was left with five children to take care of alone. To be able to make a living she opened a small daycare where she can help other working mothers by taking care of their kids, and at the same time earn income for the family. She is applying for a loan to purchase more toys and decorate another room that the children use at the daycare.

loans.use: to purchase more toys and decorate another room that the children can use at the daycare.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy little gifts, clocks, stuffed animals, and pieces of jewelry among other items

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Ms Parveen is a 39-year-old, married woman and a mother of five children. She has been running a clothing business for the past 10 years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people in her vicinity. She always has a good collection to offer to her customers. By this time she has become well known for selling good quality clothes in her community. She has been in association with Kashf Foundation for six years. Currently, she is requesting a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy a stock of different clothes for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. Parveen dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different clothes for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Even though Aba grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Aba is an entrepreneur. She sells groceries in Bukuruso (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began it 10 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their 3 children. Aba has identified that there are growing demands among consumers’ for her products. Nevertheless she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more groceries to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Ms Shameem is a 39-year-old married woman who is living with her husband and three children in Punjab, Pakistan. For about 2 years she is been engaged in hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a client base that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy reels of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way, she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to increase her income by targeting more customers. Shameem dreams of her children's bright future. She is very thankful to Kashf for the tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Afaf

texts.en: Afaf is a 40-year-old single lady living with her mother. She has a number of sheep that provide milk for dairy product production and sales. She also sells sheep. She is applying for a loan to purchase new pots and other tools needed for her dairy venture. She also wants to increase her herd of sheep and goats.

loans.use: to purchase new pots and tools needed for her dairy business.

loans.name: Mercedes Rosa

texts.es:
Mercedes de 49 años de edad es madre soltera de un hijo de doce años. Labora como independiente desde su hogar realizando comidas, pasabocas y postres para reuniones y fechas especiales. De esta manera Mercedes se gana la vida y le brinda a su hija la oportunidad ir a la escuela. 
Con el fin de mejorar sus preparaciones, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en una capacitación consistente en la elaboración de bizcochos y cubiertas.
Espera que con dicha inversión pueda ofrecerles a sus clientes mayor variedad de productos y una mejor calidad en el servicio.
Sueña con montar una panadería en su barrio y mejorar su condición  económica.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 49 years old and a single mother of a twelve-year-old child. She works independently from her home making food, snacks, and desserts for gatherings and special occasions. In this way, Mercedes earns a living and gives her daughter the opportunity to go to school.

In order to improve her techniques, she is requesting a loan that she will invest some solid training in preparing cookies and frosting. She hopes that with this loan, she will be able to offer her customers a greater variety of products and a higher quality of service.

She dreams of opening a bakery in her neighborhood and improving her economic condition.

loans.use: to get training in preparing bizcochos (cookies) and frosting.

loans.name: Roxana Raquel

texts.es:
Roxana,  tiene una tienda de productos primera necesidad. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora quien con esfuerzo y sacrificio  ha logrado salir adelante, vive con sus padres y dos hermanos, no tiene familiares en el extranjero; el oficio lo heredo de sus padres, el cual lo ha venido desempeñando desde hace 10 años, lo realiza desde las 7:00 am hasta las 5:00 pm. Una de las ventajas es que se encuentra ubicada en un punto accesible para los clientes y con poca competencia.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá invertirlo en la compra de azúcar, frijol, arroz, aceite, sal, papel higiénico, jabón para lavar trastos y ropa, entre otra mercadería para surtir el negocio; esta inversión le ayudara   a incrementar sus ingresos  económicos y con más oportunidades de crecer en el negocio para mejorar las condiciones de vida.
Su sueño es trabajar mucho para fortalecer y crecer en el negocio.
texts.en:
Roxana has a shop selling basic, staple goods.  She is a hard-working person who, with a lot of effort and sacrifice, has managed to prosper.  Roxana lives with her parents and two siblings.  She does not have any family abroad.  Roxana learned her trade from her parents and has now had the store for ten years.  She works from 7am until 5pm.  One of the strengths of the business is that it is very accessible for customers and there is little competition.

This loan will allow Roxana to buy sugar, beans, rice, oil, salt, toilet paper, soap for washing clothes and dishes, and other merchandise in order to stock up her business.  This investment will help to increase Roxana's income and give her more opportunities to expand the business and thus improve her living conditions.

Roxana's dream is to work a lot in order to strengthen and expand the business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, rice, oil, salt, toilet paper, soap for cleaning clothes and dishes and other merchandise.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus 5 hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz, fríjol desde hace  años y eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para asistir sus cultivos, sus cosechas las comercializa en los mercados de granos basicos con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Doña Raquel solicita un credito para poder mejorar el terreno donde piensa hacer su siembra que es el que muestra en la fotografia y comprar los insumos necesarios como fertilizantes , herbicidas, abonos, entre otras cosas para tener buenas cosechas y asi el pueda obtener  mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica
texts.en: Raquel lives in her own home with her husband and five children.  She has been making a living growing corn and beans for years now and this has given her experience in tending to her crops.  Raquel sells what she harvests in the basic grains market and, with the money she makes from her sales, she is able to cover household costs.  Raquel is applying for a loan to improve the land where she is thinking of planting her seeds (shown in the above photo) and to buy necessary supplies such as fertilisers, manure, herbicides and other items.  This will give her a good harvest and she will be able to earn more to give her family more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertliser, seeds, pesticides, etc and to improve the land.

loans.name: Pajaro Azul Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras de éxito una de ellas es Catalina mujer de 38 años de edad, soltera con un hijo de 20 años su negocio es la venta de ropa usada actividad que viene realizando desde hace dos años, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de pacas de ropas de mayor calidad y prendas de oro como cadenas, pulseras, anillos etc. Katerin tiene 25 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa usada y venta de nacatamales y Martha tiene 47 años de edad y su negocio es la hecha y venta de tortillas y buñuelos.
texts.en: This group is made up of three enterprising and successful members, one of whom is 38-year-old Catalina.  She is single and has a twenty-year-old son.  Her business has been selling used clothes for the last two years.  Catalina will invest the loan in buying pack of higher quality clothes in bulk and buying gold jewellery such as chains, bracelets, rings and more.  Katerin is 25 years old old and has a business selling used clothes and "nacatamales" (a corn and meat dish, wrapped in a banana leaf).  Martha is 47 years old and her business involves making and selling tortillas and sweet fritters.

loans.use: to buy higher quality packs of gold jewellery such as chains, bracelets, rings, ankle bracelets and more.

loans.name: Jose Oscar

texts.es:
José, tiene un negocio de estructuras  metálicas. El vive con sus cinco hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 10, 11, 15, 17, 21 años, el mayor trabaja mientras que los demás estudian y su esposa falleció; el oficio que realiza es elaboración de puertas y ventanas, entre otros, este lo lleva a cabo desde hace once años de  la 7:00 am hasta las 3:00 pm, lo aprendió por la misma necesidad  económica, la ventaja que posee es que cuenta con lo local y maquinaria propia para trabajar.
El préstamo que requiere lo invertirá en la comprar de hierro cuadrado para la elaboración de puertas, las cuales tiene 4 en proceso de fabricar; este le permitirá obtener más materia prima para seguir trabajando y así incrementar sus ingresos, uno de los posibles problemas  que se puede enfrentar es la variación de los precios de la materia prima.
 Su sueño es tener un negocio rentable que le ayude a optimizar las circunstancias de vida de sus hijos y apoyarles en su formación académica.
texts.en:
José has a business in metal structures. He lives with his five children, who are 10, 11, 15, 17, and 21 years old. The oldest works, while the others are still in school. His wife is deceased. His business is making doors and windows, among other things. He does this work from 7:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m. He learned the trade out of economic necessity. He has an advantage in that he has his own shop and machinery for the work.

He will invest this loan in the purchase of iron sheets for making doors. He has four that he is in the process of making. This will allow him to obtain more materials in order to continue working and to increase his income. One possible problem he faces is the fluctuation of prices for raw materials.

His dream is to have a profitable business that helps him give his children the best in life and support their academic development.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets for building doors

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, who is 58 years old, sells charcoal in Tala town. She has been in the business for the past three years, and it has been profitable.

This will be her first loan term with KADET LTD, and she plans to use the amount to buy more stock of charcoal to sell. Joyce also plans to buy more stock of paraffin to sell.

She hopes to grow her business and make more income so that she can improve her living standards as well as pay school fees for her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal and paraffin to sell.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Ms. Sajida is a 33-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has gained three years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing a stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. At the time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to lead a decent life. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

To make her store fully stocked, she needs to purchase packs of salts, biscuits and beverages. For this reason she contacted Kashf foundation and applied a loan of Rs 20,000.  She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Sadagat

texts.en:
Sadagat is a widow with one son aged 30. Since her husband died, she wanted to protect her son from feelings of want. Sadagat started to work a lot to ensure his education and future. By profession she is a nurse at the local hospital. But Sadagat has been engaged in agriculture for more than 25 years. Her primary income of source is animals: selling sheep and lambs for their meat and wool at the local bazaar. To earn extra income, she also works as a cook in local events like weddings and funerals.

Today, Sadagat has applied for a loan to buy a sheep and expand business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Leydi Yamileth

texts.es:
Leydi, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, este le permitirá comprar materia prima para la elaboración de antojitos, entre otros tales como: maíz, azúcar, aceite, harina de pan, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a  aumentar las ganancias, ser un negocio más rentable, asimismo las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Leydi is requesting a new loan because she needs to continue investing in her business. The loan will enable her to purchase raw materials, such as corn, sugar, oil, and bread flour, for making snacks.

The previous loan helped her to increase her profits and have a more profitable business. Her economic conditions and her family circumstances have also improved.

loans.use: to purchase corn, sugar, oil, and bread flour

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is a 43-year-old married woman. Four months ago, she started a small general store in her community. She offers various goods for daily use and earns enough income to contribute to the family income. Her husband is a laborer, but his income insufficient to support his family alone. Abida is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide for her family. Because she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of  20,000 PKR to buy stocks of rice and flour, packs of biscuits, and beverages from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice and flour, packs of biscuits, and beverages from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase staple grains, eggs, and dairy products

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en: Ms. Naheed is a 26-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the past year. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and a good client list. Her husband is employed in a small factory, and his income  is not sufficient to support his family by itself. Naheed is a mother who is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she has applied for a loan of PKR 15,000 to buy a stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower prices. She would then be able to meet increasing demand consistently. She wishes to use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and part to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower prices to stock her store.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en: Ms. Shakeela is a 39-year-old married woman. Six years ago, she started her own business selling clothing.  Her husband sells scrap, but his earnings are not enough to cover their household expenses. She didn’t lose hope, and she started a small business selling clothing. She buys clothing of various designs in the market in bulk at lower prices  and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a good client list, and most of her clients are her neighbors. She is the mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She contacted Kashf Foundation on the advice of a neighbor, to expand her business. Now she is applying to Kashf Foundation for a loan of PKR 25,000. She is going to use this loan to buy an ample assortment of summer clothing to add to her current supply. She dreams of providing a quality education to her children, through all her hard work.

loans.use: to buy a larger supply and variety of summer clothing to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Ms. Sajida is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. For the past 11 years, Sajida has been running a business selling milk. She started her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family, at a time when her husband was the only breadwinner in the family. With the passage of time, her sales increased, as did her income. This has all happened because of her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters, as well as financial matters. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy another buffalo. She is in her third loan cycle with Kashf Foundation. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo for her dairy business.

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en: Ms. Riffat is a 30-year-old, a vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She is an expert in making unique and stylish clothes, and she uses the income to support her entire family. However, because of a lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demand from her customers. For this reason, she applied to Kashf Foundation for a loan of PKR 25,000. She intends to use this loan to buy spools of thread in different colors, as well as packs of laces, zippers and buttons, to make it possible to increase her revenues, so she may be able to generate a healthier flow of income. She is in her second loan cycle and thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread in different colors, as well as packs of laces, zippers and buttons, for her business.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Ms Shazia, 32, is a married woman. She has been in the business of selling milk for past six years. She has two cows in milk. She sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She has two daughters, both of whom go to school. She is highly motivated to provide them with a beautiful life, one with good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to cover the day-to-day living expenses. This is her second year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business with support from Kashf. She has some past savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 10,000 to buy another cow. She hopes to achieve an increase in her milk production capacity, which will ultimately help to generate more cash.

loans.use: to buy another cow for her dairy business.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz  de 64 años de edad,  es estilista, en un local ubicado en su vivienda,  el cual aprovecha para vender mercancía cosmética y capilar, además de todo lo que su clientela le solicita como calzado, ropa, accesorios femeninos etc. Ella vende de contado y también a crédito, mientras compra solo de contado s proveedores de productos de belleza y en centros comerciales. Su día laboral inicia desde las 9 de la mañana y termina a la 9 de la noche, momentos en los cuales está dedicada a su clientela, conformada por vecinos del sector, amigos y referidos, que se han convertido en su clientela fija. Su negocio inició cuando falleció su esposo y al verse sola, decidió generar ingresos mediante la venta de pocos productos variados  y posteriormente se preparó en técnicas de belleza, actividades que hoy combina perfectamente y son los que generan ingresos para sostener su hogar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará bolsos, vestidos, calzado y productos de peluquería, para utilizarlos como insumos y también para venderlos.  Su meta es continuar apoyando a sus hijos y su mayor desafío fue lograr sola sostener su familia y esto también es su mayor éxito.
texts.en:
Beatriz, 64, is a hair stylist in a space set up in her home.  She makes the most of it to sell cosmetics and hair products as well as everything her customers request, such as footwear, clothing, women's accessories, etc.  She accepts cash and credit, while she uses only cash to buy from suppliers of beauty products and in shopping centers.

Her work day begins at 9 a.m and ends at 9 p.m.  She dedicates this time to her customers, who are neighbors from the area, friends, and referrals who have become her steady customers.

She started her business when her husband died.  On finding herself alone, she decided to generate income by selling a few products.  Later she trained in beauty techniques.  Today she combines these activities perfectly and they generate the income to support her household.

Currently she's applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With it she'll buy bags, dresses, footwear, and hair products to use as supplies as well as to sell.

Her goal is to continue supporting her children.  Her biggest challenge was managing to support her family, which is also her biggest success.

loans.use: to buy bags, dresses, footwear, and hair products

loans.name: Estrella Del Norte Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por cinco socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Angela mujer de 26 años de edad, casada, con un hijo de dos años, su negocio es la venta ropa nueva, zapatos de damas, cosméticos de la Zermat y prendas romanel, tiene 7 años de dedicarse a esa actividad anteriormente era ama de casa, de estar con la institución tiene cuatro años que a demostrado responsabilidad en sus pagos el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa de adulto como pantalón de varón, pantalón de mujer, camisas de hombre, blusas de dama, prendas como cadenas, pulseras, anillos, pulseras de pies, zapatos de damas, etc. el crédito anterior le permitió comprar más productos variados como las prendas y los cosméticos. Ana tiene 35 años su negocio es la venta de ropa de mujer, zapatos de damas, Angela tiene 47 años su negocio es venta de ropa y zapatos, Lili tiene 33 años su negocio también es la venta de ropa y zapatos y Judith tiene 21 años su negocio es tener una pulpería en su domicilio.
texts.en:
This group is made up of five enterprising members, one of whom is Angela, a 26-year-old woman who is married with a two-year-old child. She sells new clothing, women's shoes, Zermat cosmetics, and Romanel products. She has had this business for seven years. Before that, she was a housewife. She has been with the institution for four years, and has demonstrated responsibility in her repayments. She will invest this loan in the purchase of clothing for adults, such as men's and women's pants and shirts; as well as jewelry such as chains, bracelets, rings, and anklets; women's shoes; and other items.
Her previous loan allowed her to buy more and varied products such as garments and cosmetics.
Ana is 35 and sells women's clothing and shoes. Angela is 47 and sells clothing and shoes. Lili is 33 and also sells clothing and shoes. Judith is 21 and has a general store in her home.

loans.use: to purchase clothing such as men's and women's pants, men's and women's shirts; gold jewelry like chains, bracelets, rings, and anklets; women's shoes; etc.

loans.name: Jose Ismael

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos y crianza de cerdos. El vive con su familia, su esposa y cuatro hijos los cuales están estudiando; el oficio lo heredo de su padre y este lo lleva a cabo desde las 5:00 am hasta las 4:00 pm.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar insumos agrícolas tales como: abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar el rendimiento de sus cosechas. El riesgo que existe en esta actividad son los  cambios drásticos que afectan la producción o una posible plaga en el cultivo.
Su sueño es seguir trabajando mucho para obtener una buena cosecha para mejorar los ingresos económicos y asimismo darle una mayor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José plants basic staples and raises hogs. He lives with his family - a wife and four children, who are in school. He inherited his work from his father, and works from 5:00 am to 4:00 pm.
He needs this loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as manure, herbicides, pesticides, and insecticides. This investment will help him to improve his yield. The risks in this line of work include drastic changes that affect production, and plagues.
His dream is to keep working a lot in order to obtain a good harvest and improve his income, thus providing his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, and other items.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a farmer from Ndunyu Njeru. He used his previous loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting. His investment was profitable, and he was able to pay back the entire loan amount on time.

David has applied for his fourth loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy fertilizer and more seeds for planting. He anticipates making more profit, which he will use to pay school fees for his children.

He hopes to expand his farming business by planting more cash crops, thereby making more income and improving the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Hakim

texts.en: Hakim is a 21-year-old married lady. The man shown in the photo is Hakim’s husband, who is a wholesaler by profession. He purchases different goods from the market and then sells them to various shops, transporting them by motorcycle. He has been doing this for many years in order to meet the family's expenses. In order to increase their sales, Hakim has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 from the Kashf Foundation. The loan would enable her husband to purchase more items such as packs of biscuits, grains, and sweets. Hakim is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one and will bring positive changes to her husband's business.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as packs of biscuits, grains, and sweets.

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.en:
Gulzar is a 47-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of making footballs for 5 years. She stitches balls of different sizes and sells them in her community and in the local market. She is famous in her town for providing good quality footballs, and she earns enough to bear the expenses of her family members. She is contributing much to the family income, as her husband’s income is not sufficient to fulfill the demands of his family members alone. 
 
Gulzar is a motivated mother of four children. She is responsible for providing them with good quality food, education, and clothing. For the improvement of her business, she contacted a Kashf Foundation business development officer for a loan of 25,000 PKR. The loan will be used to purchase rubber bladders, leather covers, and spools of thread in large quantities, which will allow her to cater more customers without delay. She hopes to expand her business, which ultimately will help to generate more cash. She would like to spend part of her anticipated profits on her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of materials for making footballs

loans.name: Keyvin Omar

texts.es:
Keyvin, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos tales como: frijol y maíz, vive con su mama y sus hermanas, no tiene familiares en el extranjero; el oficio lo realiza desde hace ochos años y este lo aprendió con sus padres, lo lleva a cabo de 6:00 am a 2:00 pm.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar insumos agrícolas como: abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, entre otros; la inversión le ayudara a tener una siembra segura y obtener ingresos.
Su sueño es ayudar a su familia con los gastos y aumentar la producción.
texts.en:
Keyvin cultivates basic staples such as beans and corn. He lives with his mother and sisters and has no family abroad. He has been a farmer for eight years and learned this work from his parents. He works from 6:00 am to 2:00 pm.
This loan will allow him to purchase agricultural supplies such as manure, herbicides, insecticides, pesticides, and other items. This investment will help him to have a secure crop and to obtain income.
His dream is to help his family with their costs and to increase production.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides, insecticides, pesticides, and other items.

loans.name: Japhesa

texts.en:
Japhesa is a 43-year-old secondhand clothing dealer in Kongowea, Mombasa, Kenya. He is a married man whose spouse provides additional income, and together they support three people.

This loan will be his second to finance his business. Japhesa will use the loan to purchase bales of secondhand jackets and raincoat, which will be in demand for the coming season. He will use the anticipated profit to expand his shop. He hopes to succeed in this business and become a wholesale trader of secondhand clothes.

loans.use: to purchase bales of secondhand jackets and raincoats

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 50 years old. He lives in a small village in the Tskaltubo District with his wife, two children, grandson, and mother, who is provided with a retirement pension. David requested loans from local financial institutions several times in order to start a family business, without any success. His loan requests were always rejected on the basis of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

David's family is involved in agricultural activities. They have a plot of land, where they grow different kinds of vegetables. David’s son works as an artisan and gets a small monthly income. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the "subsistence poor" category. 

David has requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up and restart-up credit with soft conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to other credit products because they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers.” With his loan, David will build a greenhouse. After the greenhouse is built, he plans to sow vegetables. The harvested vegetables will be sold at local markets, which he hopes will increase the family's income. David anticipates that the new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es: Matilde es una microempresaria de muchos éxitos y emprendedora en su negocio, es una mujer de 45 años de edad, casada, con cuatro hijos varones de 6, 20, 24 y 27 años de edad, desde hace 15 años destaza cerdos en pie lo cual vende fritos con tortillas, nacatamales, chicharrón y comida al medio día. Cuenta con seis trabajadores que le ayudan al negocio así como dos de sus hijos le ayudan a despachar y vender sus productos.
