loans.use: to help her purchase more maize and rice for resale.

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en: A government employee during the day, Hayat, a 43-year-old hardworking mother of one daughter, sells home products in the afternoon from home. Her husband has a clothing sales shop, and together they are trying to offer the best to their daughter. Now Hayat is requesting a loan to purchase more home products and decoration pieces.

loans.use: to buy more home products and decoration pieces.

loans.name: Comfort Abena

texts.en:
Comfort Abena, a married mother of four children, received schooling to the end of junior high school. For about two years now, she has been selling cooked rice in Afosua, near Cape Coast. Her husband is a teacher, and Comfort Abena’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses.

Comfort Abena will use this loan to increase her existing rice capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, she plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing rice capacity

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma, age 40, is married and has three school-going children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a retail business, selling at the market to market dwellers and passers-by. Mwanajuma cites seasonality to be her major challenge. She dreams of expanding and establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the 30,000 KES loan she wants to purchase cooking fat, rice, beans, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking fat, rice, beans, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Vecinas Alegres Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado VECINAS ALEGRES está en su ciclo número 6, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, que les permite conocer la situación de cada una. Dos de las miembros se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy bajos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Emilce, quien es una de esas miembros con ingresos bajos, pero pese a ello, se esfuerza para poder salir adelante y crecer.Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que va empezando a cargar su kiosco para ir teniendo mayor variedad de golosinas, galletitas y artículos de primera necesidad como arroz, fideos, azúcar y entre otros, también se debe destacar el trabajo y las ganas que ella pone para salir adelante.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de artículos para su kiosco, como ser golosinas, comestibles bebidas y demás, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Vecinas Alegres ["Happy Neighbours"] group is in its sixth cycle. The members are doing a survey on poverty elimination and know each member's situation. Two of the members are below the poverty line; they have very low incomes.
Emilce is one of the group members with a low income. Despite this, she works hard to get ahead and grow. Among work that she does, she says that she is starting to stock her kiosk in order to have a greater variety of candy, biscuits, and basic staples like rice, noodles, and sugar. It is necessary to mention her hard work and her desire to get ahead.
She is requesting this loan for the purchase of items for her kiosk, such as candy, food, and drinks. This will help her to solidify her business plan and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy candy, food, drinks, and more items.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, surge la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo para  invertir más en el negocio para el fortalecimiento del mismo; este le permitirá comprar artículos de primera necesidad tales como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, maíz, entre otros productos.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a mejorar sus ventas y obtener ingresos; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Juan needs a new loan in order to invest more in his business and to strengthen it. This will allow him to buy basic staples such as rice, sugar, beans, and corn.
His previous loan helped him to improve his sales and make an income. His economic conditions and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, corn, and other products.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María, solicita un nuevo préstamo para fortalecer  más el negocio, ya que los préstamos son una fuente favorable para adquirir ganancias; este le permitirá comprar tela, hilo, botones, zippers, entre otros materiales.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a arreglar su máquina y obtuvo mejores beneficios. Las condiciones económicas han mejorado y las circunstancias familiares se mantienen.
texts.en:
María is applying for a new loan to further build up her business, as the loans are an advantageous source for acquiring earnings. This will allow her to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers and other materials.

The previous loan helped her fix her machine and obtain better profits. Her financial situation has improved and her family circumstances remain the same.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers and other supplies.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Even though she did not receive any formal education, Maame, a divorced mother of seven, is a successful businesswoman. She has been selling kooko (porridge) in Afosua, near Cape Coast, for about 12 years. As the sole breadwinner of the family, Maame uses her income to provide for the entire family.

Maame will use this loan to purchase increased amounts of corn flour to make kooko in order to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to further diversify the types of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of corn flour to make kooko.

loans.name: El Esfuerzo Unido Group

texts.es: En el Banco Comunal El Esfuerzo Unido, que está ubicado en Concepción, VIII región de Chile, hay variados negocios como lo son la venta de ropa usada, venta de comida y venta en ferias libres. Una de las socias es Marcela, que aparece al costado derecho de la fotografía con chaqueta de cuero negra, y entre dos hombres, ella vende ropa y cosas usadas en la feria libre. Hace mas o menos unos 6 años que comenzó con su negocio, y lo hizo porque un día acompaño a sus padres a vender y le gusto mucho el buen ambiente que había. Nos cuenta que no ha tenido grandes problemas dentro de su negocio, lo que si nos cuenta que cuando ocurrió el terremoto el año 2010, ella tenía un negocio establecido en un local, pero se lo saquearon y ella perdió además mucha mercadería, lo cual la dejo muy afectada. El préstamo que está solicitando lo ocupará para comprar más mercadería para su negocio y así poder ahorrar dinero y poder establecerse otra vez con su negocio, y por ende espera que le vaya muy bien en este nuevo ciclo. Y lo que más le ha gustado de trabajar con Fondo Esperanza es que confían en las personas y las ayudan.
texts.en:
In the El Esfuerzo Unido [United Effort] Communal Bank, which is located in Concepción, in the VIII region of Chile, there are various businesses such as: used clothing sales, food sales, and sales in markets. One of the group members is Marcela, who appears in the right of the photo in the black leather jacket, standing between two men. She sells used clothing and other items in a market. She started her business about six years ago, and she did so because one day she went with her parents to sell and she really enjoyed the atmosphere. She tells us that she has not had any major problems with her business. However, she says that when the earthquake struck in 2010 she had had an established business, but it was ransacked and she lost a lot of merchandise, which left her greatly affected. 
She will use this loan to buy more merchandise for her business, so that she can save up money and firmly establish her business. She hopes that this new cycle will go very well for her. What she has always most enjoyed about working with Fondo Esperanza is that they trust and help people.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ten bags of fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, and corn seed; and to pay labourers.

loans.name: Maryana

texts.en:
Maryana is an 18-year-old single lady living with her parents. To help in supporting the family, she sells cosmetics and makeup products from home to friends and neighbors.

Now Maryana is applying for a youth loan to get new brands of cosmetics and makeup products to increase the quantity she has and have a variety of goods. She hopes that later on she would be able to open her own cosmetics and accessories shop.

loans.use: to bring in other brands of cosmetics and make up products

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua sells rice in Afosua (near Cape Coast). She has been educated until the end of primary school.  She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a farmer.

Akosua has been working in this enterprise for 2 years now. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to increase her current stock levels. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her rice enterprise and increase her capital base. In the long run, she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to increase her current stock levels

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman; she has children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates a fish-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other fish sellers in her business.
 
With the Kshs 15,000 loan she wants to purchase bundles of fish to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fish to sell

loans.name: Noralba

texts.es:
Noralba de 45 años de edad, es una mujer apasionada por su trabajo y dedicada a su familia. Desde hace algunos años se encuentra administrando el negocio de su hermano dedicado a la preparación de alimentos. Por exigencia de la secretaría de salud, debe realizar un análisis microbiológico y un plan de saneamiento, pero como no cuenta con los recursos económicos se encuentra solicitando un crédito para realizar dicha inversión y mejorar la calidad en la prestación del servicio.

Su mayor sueño es poder comprarle el negocio a su hermano debido a que este se encuentra fuera del país.
texts.en:
Noralba is 45 years old, and a woman passionate about her work and devoted to her family. For several years she has been running her brother's food preparation business.

As required by the Ministry of Health, she must undertake a microbiological analysis and a clean-up plan, but as she doesn't have the financial resources, she is requesting a loan so that she can undertake this investment and improve service quality.

Her greatest dream is to be able to buy her brother's business due to the fact that he is living outside the country.

loans.use: To undertake a microbiological analysis and a cleanup plan.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married and has children all under her care. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a vegetable and fruit selling business for the past years. For that reason, with the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase green vegetables,  and sacks of fruits such as oranges and mangoes. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits such as oranges and mangoes

loans.name: Confort

texts.en:
Confort is a small-scale fish vendor in her location near Cape Coast. She has had some form of formal education as she is a primary school graduate. She is married and has 6 children. Her husband is a farmer.

Confort has been working as a fish vendor for a number of years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of fish, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to develop her business further and ensure that all her children receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of fish thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand

loans.name: Festus

texts.en: This marks Festus' fifth loan after repaying the previous ones successfully. He will purchase fabric material to make his local purchase order of aprons and shirts requested by an engineering firm in their tender submitted to him. He hopes to win more tenders in the future and grow his business in his locality and outside.

loans.use: to buy fabric material

loans.name: Sonia Roxana

texts.es:
Sonia, requiere un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de adquirir más mercadería para el negocio de venta de ropa americana; este le permitirá comprar blusas, pantalones, chores, entre otros productos.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus inventarios  y las utilidades  las invirtió en la reparación de la vivienda;  mantiene el mismo grupo familiar y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado, asimismo las condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Sonia needs a new loan because she needs to buy more merchandise for her business selling American clothing. This loan will allow her to buy shirts, pants, shorts, and other items.
Her previous loan allowed her to expand her inventory and she invested her profit in home repairs. She still has the same family group and their situation has improved, as have their economic conditions.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, shorts, and other items.

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
El Grupo de "Santa Rosa" esta conformado por siete integrantes seis mujeres y un hombre pero todos son muy responsables y trabajadores, platican que el nonbre decidieron ponerselo porque así se llama la patrona del pueblo, es una de las virgenes mas celebradas en la comunidad donde viven.
Doña Magdalena es integrante del grupo, platica tiene 38 años de edad y esta casada con el señor Lucas desde hace 20 años juntos han formado una familia con tres niños de los cuales solo uno va a la escuela porque los otros dos niños aun son pequeños. 
Doña Magadalena se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace dos años platica que inicio con su actividad porque muchas veces su esposo se encuentra desempleado y tenian muchos problemas economicos. Doña Magdalena comenta "Me gusta mucho apoyar a mi esposo con los gastos del hogar y la educacion de mis hijos, con mis ganancias vivimos mas tranquilos sin preocupaciones economicas". Doña Magdalena todos los fines de semana viaja a la capital para comprar mas ropa que seguramente les encargaron sus clientas y todos los dias sale a vender a otras comunidades de casa en casa ofreciendo su mercancia. 
La unica dificultad de Doña Magdalena es cuando sus clientes se tardan mucho tiempo en pagarle, Doña Magadalena sonriendo comentó "Tambien me gustaria mucho tener un automovil para transportarme mas rapido y asi entregar a tiempo mis pedidos".
Doña Magdalena esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas ropa en general esta vez piensa comprar mas ropa que se encuentre a la moda porque así sera mas fácil vender sus prendas, sus ganancias le ayudarian a solventar los gastos del hogar, pero sobretodo la educacion de su hijo, para Doña Magdalena lo mas importante son sus niños.
El grupo esta muy contento y agradecido con Vision Fund y KIVA por el credito que cada integrante recibira ya que para ellos sea de gran ayuda para hacer crecer sus negocios. Como Don Luis invertira en sus juegos artificiales, Doña Cristina invertira en su tienda de abarrotes, Elizabeth, Acela, Teresa, Norma invertiran en borregos para engorda y venta, Doña Luisa invertira en Baberos para su venta y Sandy invertira en una tienda escolar.
texts.en:
The "Santa Rosa" group has seven members, six of whom are women. They are all very responsible and hard-working. They say that they chose their name after the patron saint of their village, one of the most celebrated in their community.
Magdalena is a member of this group. She tells us that she is 38 and has been married to Lucas for 20 years. Together, they have formed a family. They have three children, of whom only one goes to school because the others are still little.
Magdalena has sold clothing for two years. She tells us that she started her business because her husband is often unemployed and they had many economic problems. She says "I really like helping my husband with the household costs and our children's education. My earnings allow us to live more comfortably without worrying about finances." Every weekend, Magdalena travels to the capital to buy more clothing that her clients order. Every day, she goes out to sell door-to-door in other communities.
Magdalena's only difficulty occurs when clients are very late in paying her. Smiling, she says "I would also love to have a car to get around more quickly and get my orders in on time."
Magdalena is requesting this loan for the purchase of more clothing. She plans to purchase more in-style clothing because it will be easier to sell. Her earnings will help her to cover her household costs, but above all it will pay for her children's education. For Magdalena, her children are the most important aspect of life.
The group is very happy and grateful to Vision Fund and Kiva for the loan that each of them will receive, since it will be a great help for them in expanding their businesses. Luis will invest in his juice business; Cristina will invest in her grocery store; Elizabeth, Acela, Teresa, and Norma will invest in buying sheep to fatten and sell; Luisa will invest in buying aprons for sale; and Sandy will invest in her school supply store.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

location.town: Rioyos Buenavista, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John operates a general shop and has been in the business for the past 12 years. He has applied for his fourth loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy more stock including rice, sugar, flour and soap. He paid his previous loan well and in good time.

He hopes to own a supermarket in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock including rice, sugar, flour and soap.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, 44 years old,  is a new clothes dealer in Kongowea, Mombasa. He is a married father who supports four in his family and whose spouse also provides some income.

This marks his second borrowing from KADET LTD to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase new dresses and women's suits for resale with the anticipated profit to provide basic needs for the family. 

He hopes to be successful and financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase new dresses and women's suits for his shop

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol. El tiene 36 años de edad, está casado y su esposa tiene 28 años de edad, actualmente no tiene hijos; el oficio lo aprendió con su padre desde muy pequeño y este lo realiza junto con él.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, semilla y toda la preparación para la tierra; esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar la producción y obtener mayores ingresos.
Su objetivo es fortalecer el negocio y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa, asimismo tener hijos.
texts.en:
Roberto cultivates corn and beans. He is 36 and married. His wife is 28. They do not have any children at the moment. Roberto learned to farm from his father at a young age, and they still farm together.
He needs this loan to buy manure, herbicides, insecticides, pesticides, and seeds, and to prepare the land. This investment will help him to increase production and to obtain a better income.
His goal is to strengthen his business and offer  his wife a better quality of life. He also wants to have children.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides, insecticides, pesticides, and seeds, and to prepare the land.

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
José tiene 58 años de edad. Desde hace 40 años trabaja en las labores agrícolas.; sus padres fueron quienes le enseñaron. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar semilla de sandia para empezar a cultivar, para la compra de foliares, fertilizantes para cultivar maíz y pago de mano de obra. Con la inversión comprara los insumos para cultivar sandia y maíz, pretende que con la producción de sandia pagara el crédito y con la de maíz le quedara para el consumo y para vender obteniendo ingresos para la familia.
texts.en:
José is 58. He has been a farmer for 40 years; his parents taught him this work.
He is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo for the purchase of watermelon seeds to start to sow, and for the purchase of plant nutrients and fertilizers for cultivating corn, and to pay labourers. With this investment he will purchase supplies for cultivating watermelon and corn. With his production of watermelon, he will repay the loan. The corn production will give him enough to consume and also to sell for income for his family.

loans.use: to buy watermelon seeds to start to plant; to buy plant nutrients; and to pay labourers.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is married and has three school going children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a cereal shop business, selling to market dwellers and passersby. She cites seasonality to be her major challenge.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase rice, beans, wheat and maize for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, wheat and maize for resale.

loans.name: Moris

texts.en:
Moris is 33 years old. He lives in Kareli District with his sister and father. Moris requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a 1.78-hectare plot of land where haricot, maize and beets are grown. They sell the harvested products locally. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Moris requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Moris has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Moris will 10 beehives with bee colonies. After the beehives are purchased, they will be able to produce honey for selling. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase beehives with bee colonies.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is  married, and together with her husband, lives in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuations in her business, but she dreams of establishing a wholesale vegetable stall in the future. 

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, beans, wheat, rice, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, beans, wheat, rice, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, and both of them attend school. She is looking after another family member (her brother's child).

She has been selling charcoal from home, both wholesale and retail, for 10 years, working six days a week. She also earns additional income from her rental houses.

She has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock a full lorry of charcoal for sale. Her challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her dream is to buy her own truck to help in the transportation of the charcoal from the villages, and also, to sell on a wholesale basis only. 

She joined MCDT because of the good customer care exhibited during the training. She stays in her husband's house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy a lorry load of charcoal.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is 27 years old and from Migori. She is married to Oroo, who is a businessman within the same market. She supports four people in her family; she has three children who are 6 years, 4 years and 6 months old.

She sells second-hand clothes like bedcovers and bedsheets. She has been doing this business for the last five years and makes a monthly income of 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). She is taking her second loan with KADET LTD., which she will use to purchase bedcovers and second-hand clothes in bulk for resale. She will use the anticipated profit to improve the business.

Her dream is to make a better future.

loans.use: to purchase bedcovers and second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Kancou's Group

texts.fr:
Créer en Juillet 2008 le groupe Mampatim a plus de cinq cycles (presque 3 ans) dans le programme des Bancs Villageois. 
Il  est composé de 33 femmes qui vivent dans le même village, elles partagent les valeurs de solidarités et d’entre aides. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Kancou (levant la main à droite sur la photo), est la représentante du groupe. Elle est âgée de  52ans, mariée et mère de trois enfants dont deux filles. Son activité consiste à l’achat de produits de consommation courante en gros dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour la revendre au détail dans sa petite cantine au village.

Avec son nouveau prêt elle compte acheter un bidon d’huile de palm à 20 000 F CFA, un sac de sucre à 25 000 F CFA, trois sacs de riz à 13 000 F CFA  le sac, un sac d’ognon à 10 000 F CFA et des bouillons.

Les bénéfices de cette activité serviront à accroître son épargne d’une part et d’autre part à prendre en partie les frais scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Created in July 2008, the Mampatim group has had over five cycles (nearly three years) in the Bancs Villageois program.
The group is made up of 33 women who live in the same village and share the values of solidarity and helping one another. They are mainly small business owners.
Madame Kancou (raising her hand in the right of the photo) is the group representative. She is 52 and married with two daughters and one son. She buys food products in bulk from the weekly markets and resells them at retail prices at her small shop in the village
With her new loan, she plans to buy a tin of palm oil for 20 000 F CFA, one bag of sugar for 25 000 F CFA, three bags of rice for 13 000 F CFA per bag, one bag of onions for 10 000 F CFA, and some broth.
The income from this will allow her to increase her savings and to contribute to her children's school costs.

loans.use: to buy food in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Swalehe

texts.en:
Swalehe is 59 years old. He is a married man with seven children, all of whom graduated from school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Swalehe has operated a timber selling business for the past five years, selling from home to his neighbors. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. 

With the loan he is requesting, he wants to purchase more timber for resale. He dreams of expanding his business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more timber for resale.

loans.name: Sect 28 Wendsongdo Group

texts.fr:
Mme PAKRE  CLARISSE  est responsable du groupe SECT 28 WENDSONGDO. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 27ans et le moins âgé a 13ans. Les 03 vont à l’école. Mme a 06 personnes en charge.
Mme vend des sacs à main et chaussures depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne chez les grossistes. Ses clients sont dans les services.
Elle veut s’acheter  une douzaine de sacs à main et 09 paires de chaussure.
Mme veut  renforcer son activité avec ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une boutique pour son activité et aider son mari pour la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Mme Pakre Clarisse is responsible for the Sect 28 Wendsongdo group. She is a married mother of three, the eldest being 27 and the youngest being 13. All three of her children go to school. Pakre Clarisse cares for six people.
She has sold handbags and shoes for five years. She buys her stock from wholesalers. Her clients work in the service industry.
She wants to buy a dozen handbags and nine pairs of shoes.
She wants to strengthen her business. Her ambition is to open a boutique and to help her husband with their children's education costs.

loans.use: to buy a dozen handbags and 9 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Noël

texts.fr: Noël est âgé de 41 ans et est marié à une marchande du nom de Antoinette. Le couple a cinq enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Noël vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Noël n’a pas fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la menuiserie. Noël exerce ce métier depuis treize ans ; ce qui lui permet subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Noël s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. En vue de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Noël sollicite pour la quatrième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits précédemment obtenus ont tous été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Noël is 41 and married to a merchant named Antoinette. They have five children, some of whom are in school and all of whom are under their care.
Noël lives with his wife and children. Together, the couple cares for their family. Noël did not go to school, but he learned carpentry. He has done this work for thirteen years, and it allows him to cover his family's needs. He gets his supplies in a town in Bénin. In order to satisfy customer demand, he is requesting his fourth loan from ALIDé. His previous loans were all payed back well.

loans.use: to buy beams.

loans.name: Kandit

texts.en:
Kandit is 61 years old. He lives in Bolnisi District with his wife and son. Kandit requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for his family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a 0.6-hectare plot of agricultural land, where they grow maize and haricot (beans). They sell the harvested products at local markets. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs in the subsistence poor category. 

Kandit requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Kandit has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides credit with "soft conditions" to start or restart businesses. The program is targeted to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as high risk borrowers because of their low incomes. With his credit Kandit will purchase a milking cow. After purchasing a milking cow, he will be able to produce dairy products and sell them locally. This will increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is forty years old, married to Lydiah and is blessed with two children. Geoffrey runs a retail shop in Kawangware and also has a matatu transport business in the local market. He has been in the business for nineteen years and he gets a monthly income of KES. 50,000
This will be Geoffrey's tenth loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to add stock like bails of flour and rice and also use some of the money to service the matatu.
With the profits, he wants to expand his business. In the future he wants to educate his children and be a prosperous business man.

loans.use: to purchase bails of flour, rice etc to stock his store.

loans.name: Five Stars Group

texts.en: This is 37-year-old Vainah from Harare. She is a widow with two children, both attending school. She also takes care of her mother. Vainah buys and sells tackies and tennis shoes for adults and childre. She has been in operation for 14 years. She says the main challenges faced are stiff competition with other sellers and the weather. Vainah has requested a loan of $500 to buy tackies and tennis shoes for the winter. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to pay fees for her children and put the rest back into the business. In the future, Vainah plans to have her own footwear shop and have employees.

loans.use: to buy footwear for the winter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more weaves & clothing to sell.

loans.name: Kamotsi Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is Eve, the leader of Kamotsi group. She needs working capital to buy fabric for her tailoring business. She says paying fees has not been much of a problem since she has been using profits from the business. Eve now has two employees. Power supply and stiff competition still remain a challenge in her business. Eve has requested a loan of $1000 to buy fabric like Mandy, poly cotton, koshibo and suiting materials for tailoring.

loans.use: to buy fabric and tailoring materials.

loans.name: Rhafinos

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Rhafinos from Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe.  Rhafinos means “he who does not sleep” and he is single with no children.  He cares for one dependent. 

Rhafinos runs a retail business, selling groceries and his business has been in operation for 1.5 years.  He says the main challenge he faces is the lack of capital to buy goods in bulk.  Rhafinos has requested a loan of $350 in order to buy more groceries for resale.  He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to look after his mother. 

In the future Rhafinos plans to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy more groceries.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas En Amor 3, 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Miguelina is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres unidas en Amor (United Women with Love) 3, 4  & 5. This group is located in the urban slums surrounding Los Alcarrizos, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. 

Miguelina is the mother of three children and makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children. She is excited to be taking out her second loan with Esperanza and by the opportunity to grow her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business, a small general store, where she sells different products, such as shoes, clothes, cosmetics, etc. 

Miguelina will purchase miscellaneous products to increase her business inventory and to provide for more clients in her community. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and to save for any need in her family. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy different products like household items, cosmetics, clothes, etc.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.fr: Daniel est âgé de 35 ans et est marié à une marchande du nom de Jeanne. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains sont scolarisés. Daniel vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Daniel n’a pas fréquenté l'école, et a appris la menuiserie. En plus de sa activité, Daniel vend des madriers à son domicile depuis dix ans. En vue de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Daniel sollicite pour la quatrième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Daniel is 35 years old and married to a merchant named Jeanne. The couple has four children, some of whom are in school. Daniel lives together with his wife and children. Together, the couple provides for the family's various expenses. Daniel did not attend school, and learned carpentry. In addition to his business, Daniel has sold beams at his home for ten years. With an eye to satisfying his customers' needs, Daniel is asking for a fourth loan from Alidé. His previous loans have been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy beams

loans.name: Mahounakpon Sodiane

texts.fr: Mahounakpon Sodiane est âgée de 29 ans et est une célibataire. Mahounakpon Sodiane a fréquenté l'école jusqu’au niveau secondaire. Mahounakpon Sodiane a un enfant qui est scolarisé et à sa charge. Afin de répondre à ses besoins et de subvenir aux besoins de son enfant, Mahounakpon Sodiane vend depuis deux ans de la nourriture (pomme de terre, produits congelés) à son domicile. En vue de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Mahounakpon Sodiane sollicite pour la première fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en: Mahounakpon Sodiane is 29 years old and single. Mahounakpon Sodiane attended school up to the secondary level. Mahounakpon Sodiane has one child attending school and in her care. In order to meet her needs and to provide for the needs of her child, Mahounakpon Sodiane has sold food (potatoes, frozen products) for two years at her home. With an eye to satisying her customers, Mahounakpon Sodiane is asking for a first loan from Alidé.

loans.use: to buy frozen products and potatoes

loans.name: Shorai

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe!  This is 37-year-old Shorai from Harare.  She is married and has three children, all of whom attend school.  

Shorai runs a retail business selling electrical goods, clothing and shoes.  The business has been in operation for five years.  She says the main challenge she faces is the lack of working capital.  Shorai has requested a loan of $1,000 in order to buy more electrical goods, clothing and shoes for resale.  She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to pay school fees for her three kids. 

In the future, Shorai plans to own a complex.

loans.use: to buy more electrical goods, clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Tinashe

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Tinashe from Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe.  He is married and has two children, one of whom attends school.  

Tinashe runs a retail business that sells groceries.  The business has been in operation for seven years.  He says the main challenge he faces is too much competition.  Tinashe has requested a loan of $1,500 in order to buy more groceries for resale and remain competitive.  He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable him to build a house for his family. 

In the future, Tinashe plans to open a chain supermarket in Chinhoyi.

loans.use: to buy more groceries.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
This loan will help Emmanuel improve his training facility for young athletes in his Melbourne, Florida community.

Emmanuel grew up in Melbourne playing sports and working out. After working in the health and fitness industry for over 20 years, Emmanuel saw a need for quality youth sports performance training programs in the area. In 2010, Emmanuel opened his own Parisi Speed School location, a franchise with over 80 locations nationwide that provides specialized training to help young athletes achieve their full fitness and strength potential.

Emmanuel recently relocated his business to be across the street from a major gym. Because of the move, foot traffic to his Parisi Speed School has increased by over 500%. Now with more clients, Emmanuel needs to expand. 

This loan will help Emmanuel to invest in advertising and marketing materials, and to purchase more fitness equipment — including: sleds, TRX suspension trainers, kettle bells, training ropes, medicine balls and rowers — in order to better serve his new clients.

loans.use: to purchase more fitness equipment and invest in advertising materials.

loans.name: Norvi

texts.en:
This loan will help Norvi buy a new computer server to be able to attend to even more clients. 

As a child growing up in Venezuela, Norvi loved creating and designing. She graduated with a degree in Computer Engineering and moved to the United States 14 years ago to pursue a career. But as a single mother of two, Norvi was not bringing in enough money to support her family. She decided to open her own graphic and web design studio at home to bring in more income and to spend more time with her children. 

Now, Norvi’s business, Sign Up Design, Inc., offers custom web and graphic design services for businesses and has grown to be the most chosen web and graphic design firm in Orlando’s transportation industry. 

Looking to attract more clients and expand her business, Norvi needs a loan to purchase a new computer server and business equipment in order to handle more contracts. As a result of this additional business, Norvi hopes to hire an employee and help create jobs in her community.

loans.use: to purchase a new computer server and business equipment.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas En Amor 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Shara is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres unidas en Amor 1 & 2 (United women with love). Her group is located in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial area north of the capital where free trade zones are common. She makes her home in a simple structure with her husband and their three children. She says that her most important challenge is to progress on her goals to expand her business. In the meantime she plans to continue serving in her church.

Shara is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She has had her business for approximately 6 years. She produces and sells Empanada (a fried dough filled with meat and vegetables). She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying flour, meat, cooking oil, vegetables and other goods. She will use the profits to save and to provide for the needs in her family, and also to reinvest in her cooking business. She wishes to have a successful business and help her children attend university.

loans.use: To buy flour, meat, butter, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 59 years old and married with two children.

Elizabeth works hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells dried coconut meat in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional dried coconut meat to sell.

Elizabeth has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the coconut meat business for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Elizabeth aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional dried coconut meat to sell.

loans.name: Sègla Augustin

texts.fr: Sègla Augustin est âgé de 36 ans et est marié à une marchande du nom de Rosaline. Le couple a six enfants dont certains sont scolarisés. Sègla Augustin vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme. Sègla Augustin et sa femme assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Sègla Augustin a très peu fréquenté l'école et a appris la couture. Parallèlement à cette couture, Sègla Augustin vend du thé dans une cafète, depuis dix ans. Sègla Augustin exerce passionnément ce métier, ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. En vue de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Sègla Augustin sollicite pour la deuxième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Le crédit antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Sègla Augustin is 36 years old and married to a merchant named Rosaline. The couple has six children, some of whom are in school. Sègla Augustin lives together with his children and his wife. Sègla Augustin and his wife provide for the family's various expenses together. Sègla Augustin attended little school and learned to sew. Concurrently with his sewing, Sègla Augustin has sold tea in a cafe for ten years. Sègla Augustin works passionately at his business, which allows him to meet his family's needs without great difficulty. With an eye to satisfying his customers, Sègla Augustin is asking for a second loan from Alidé. His previous loan has been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies, a refrigerator, and cafeteria accessories.

loans.name: Saïdi

texts.fr: Âgé de 25 ans, Saïdi vit dans une ville du Bénin et a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Saïdi est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Limata. Le couple a un enfant qui n’est pas encore scolarisé et qui est à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec leur enfant. Saïdi assure ensemble avec sa femme les différentes charges du ménage. Saïdi a très peu fréquenté l’école et a appris l’électricité bâtiment par la suite. Saïdi exerce passionnément cette activité depuis cinq ans dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Saïdi sollicite pour la première fois l’appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en: 25 years old, Saïdi lives in a city in Benin and left school at the primary level. Saïdi is married to a retailer named Limata. The couple has one child who isn't yet in school, and is in their care. The couple lives together with their child. Saïdi provides for his various household expenses together with his wife. Saïdi attended little school and learned to be an electrician afterward. Saïdi has worked passionately in this business for five years in his region. With the goal of satisfying his customers and increasing his turnover and revenue, Saïdi is asking for a first loan from Alidé.

loans.use: to buy electrical accessories

loans.name: Lizzy

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe!  This is 36-year-old Lizzy from Harare.  She is married and has three children, two of whom attend school.  

Lizzy runs a retail business selling clothing and shoes.  The business has been in operation for two years.  She says the main challenge she faces is the lack of a proper place to sell her products.  Lizzy has requested a loan of $500 to buy more clothing and shoes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's standard of living. 

In the future, Lizzy plans to own a big shop.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to hire additional sales staff.

loans.name: Union Y Progreso 6 Group

texts.en:
Rosanny is part of the group named Union y progreso (Union and Progress) 6. She is the representative of this group and has proven to be a very hardworking woman by operating different businesses to make extra income. This group is composed of 5 micro-entrepreneurs. They are doing business in their rural community, outside El Seybo. They sell meat, fruit and vegetables, clothes and other items. 

Rosanny is a young women and she lives together with her parents. She says that her most important challenge is to have a successful business and to become a professional. She enjoys sharing with her family and working. Rosanny sells miscellaneous products like underwear, cosmetics and shoes, either by walking into the nearest communities or directly from her home. She will use this loan to invest in her business and increase her inventory. She is on her 3th loan with Esperanza. Rosanny and her group thank you all for your support!

loans.use: To buy miscellaneous products, like cosmetics, shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Alfred M.'s Group

texts.en:
Here we meet with a team of teachers from the township of Waterloo, near Sierra Leone’s capital city of Freetown. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 8,200,000 to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month they will repay the loan, using their salaries. 

Alfred is the featured leader of this team. Born in Yele village, he is 50 years of age. He is married to a trader and the couple has 4 children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Alfred has been a professional teacher for 27 years now. He has requested his part of the loan in order to buy house building materials like sand, nails and cement, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house. He will also use part of the loan to invest in agriculture. He will buy seeds to plant palm trees.

loans.use: to buy house building materials like sand, nails and cement, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house.  He will also use part of the loan to buy seeds to plant palm trees.

loans.name: Scott

texts.en:
While most of Texas saw a problem with the ongoing drought, Scott saw an opportunity.  

Crops and livestock suffer without water, so Scott started the business, Texas Native Rainwater, to help conserve water. Scott designs rainwater harvesting and irrigation systems that store and conserve water, and ultimately save money. 

Texas Native Rainwater also installs rain gardens, a form of “passive” rainwater collection that is essentially a planted, shallow depression that collects run-off from roof surfaces, parking lots, and other surfaces. Its purpose is to retain and treat stormwater and slowly allow it back into the groundwater and ultimately, the aquifer. They also provide consultation and services on tree planting and water reclamation.

Scott started his business in the winter of 2012 and is already making a huge impact on his customers in Austin.  With a small loan from Accion Texas, Scott and his team were able to buy tools and revamp their marketing strategy to get the word out about catching rainwater. This kept the team employed, the family cared for, and the waters preserved.

loans.use: to buy tools and revamp his marketing strategy.

loans.name: De Cristo La Gloria 1, 2, 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Jhoanna is one of the members of the group called De Cristo la Gloria 1, 2, 4 & 5. They are twenty micro-business women from San Pedro de Macoris, from a batey (a company town) surrounded by sugarcane fields where they live and work for their families. They are selling clothes, miscellaneous products, shoes, groceries, food, etc. Jhoanna lives in a simple home with her family which is comprised of four members: her three children and herself.

Jhoanna is associated with Esperanza and started with us because she needed capital to reinvest in a business. She is very excited to be receiving her 6th loan from Esperanza Internacional after having successfully paid off her previous loans, and having taken steps to grow her business. She has had her business for around five years.

Jhoanna is planning to invest her new loan in purchasing rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, canned food, and other goods for daily meals. She will also buy shoes and other miscellaneous products because she runs different businesses. One is a grocery store and the other is selling shoes and other miscellaneous products. She said her most difficult challenge was to start her business. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: To buy shoes and other miscellaneous products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy house building materials like cement for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Ganbaatar, 53 years old, lives with his wife, three sons, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. This extended family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He has been rendering taxi service to local people, by renting an automobile from a private business entity for one year. His wife sells clothes, renting a stall at the trade center. His elder son has a position as a welder at a construction company, and his second son plays music at the State philharmonic hall. His daughter-in-law stays at home, looking after her children.

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years, and needs some serious repair. So, Ganbaatar is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT. He will use it to purchase building and insulation materials, such as planks, bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam. Using these materials, he can make an extension, and repair and insulate his house, thus providing more comfortable and warmer accommodations for his family. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, emit less smoke, and thereby contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual, who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Aminata B.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers from a primary school situated in Waterloo, a town near Freetown. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 8,000,000 in order to meet their most immediate and most pressing financial needs. At the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for managing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Alieu is the featured leader of this group. The 45-year-old is a native of Masiaka village. He is married to a nurse and he has 12 children – 4 in primary school, 5 in secondary and 3 are not of school-going age. Alieu has been a professional teacher for 18 years now. He is pursuing further studies in college. He has requested this loan in order to pay his college fees.

loans.use: to pay his college fees.

loans.name: Isatu B.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of primary school teachers located in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. They have come to SMT to request a loan of SLL 12,900,000 in order to meet their most pressing financial needs. At the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is responsible for managing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Isatu is the featured leader of this group. The 45-year-old is a native of Freetown city. She is married to a teacher and the couple has 4 children – 1 is attending primary school, 2 are in secondary school and 1 is in college. Isatu has been a professional teacher for 17 years now. She has requested this loan in order to pay college/school fees for her children. 

(Also attached on the photo are colleagues/borrowers who collected their loan later on)

loans.use: to pay college/school fees for her children.

loans.name: Francis F.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of hardworking and dedicated primary school teachers who are based in Grafton, on the outskirts of Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. Staff of various institutions normally come to SMT to request for loans in order to meet their most immediate financial needs. At the end of each month, they use their salaries to repay the loan. Their bursar is directly responsible for deducting their repayments and paying SMT/Kiva lenders on their behalf.

Francis is the featured leader of this team. A native of Kailahun, Francis is married to a housewife and he has 9 children who are attending primary, secondary and tertiary academic institutions. Francis has been a school teacher for 35 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials like iron corrugated sheets, sand, nails and cement, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house for his family.

loans.use: to buy house building materails like iron corrugated sheets, sand, nails and cement, etc. for the constructions of a dwelling house for his family.

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en: Mr. Myagmarsuren, 54 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His son studies at a technical college, and his daughter goes to high school. He and his family came to Ulaanbaatar five years ago in order to improve their standard of living. They immediately began their business selling Mongolian traditional gers (portable felt dwellings) after settling in Ulaanbaatar. He is applying for a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy raw materials, such as planks and felts. Using these materials, he can continue to make Mongolian traditional gers without worrying about shortages of raw materials. The borrower is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy planks and felts for his business of making and selling Mongolian traditional gers (portable felt dwellings).

loans.name: Estrelieta

texts.en: Estrelieta is married and has four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Estrelieta is 33 years old and has three children in school. She has a general store business in the Philippines. Estrelieta applied for a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, including coffee, milk, rice, soap, bread, shampoo and other groceries. Estrelieta has been in this business for two years. In the future, Estrelieta would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, including coffee, milk, rice, soap, bread, shampoo and other groceries.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell in her business. Evelyn has been in this business for eight years. Evelyn earns additional income from a general store and from buying and selling charcoal. Evelyn has been maintaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: A loan of USD1,000 is being offered to Angelina to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies, such as biscuits, noodles, sugar and coffee, and a refrigerator to keep drinks cold. She has been involved in business activities since 2008. She feels very comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Angelina independent, because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies, such as biscuits, noodles, sugar and coffee, and a refrigerator to keep drinks cold.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business fishing, and buying and selling fish, in the Philippines. Gloria applied for a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell. Gloria has been in this business for 21 years. She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now applying for a new loan to further build her fish-vending/fishing business. In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a chocolate-making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years.

Guillerma requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.  She will use the loan to purchase additional ingredients for her chocolate-making business. She would like to save enough money for future expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her chocolate-making business

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years, now.

Irma requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her food preparation business. Irma would like to save enough money for future expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: La Reforma 2, 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Agustide is the coordinator of his group, La Reforma 2, 4, 5 "Reform". This is a group of Haitian citizens who are now located in an area of San Pedro de Macoris, a town where the economy is based on the sugar cane industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water. The water is not potable. 

Agustide makes his home in a simple structure with his 4 children. He says that his most difficult challenges have been settling in a foreign city and helping his family. He plans to continue doing business and enjoying the time he spends working. He is excited to be taking out his 12th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and growing his business. He has had his business for 8 years, starting with a fruit and vegetable stand. He plans to use this loan to purchase cosmetics, shoes and clothes to sell. He will use the profits to reinvest and to provide for his children. He is dreaming of improving his business and returning to Haiti to start a good business there.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, shoes and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Yane

texts.en:
This is Yane, a 44-year-old woman who is married to Eben, a 48-year-old man. They are blessed with 4 children, namely: Yeti, 20, who is studying at a nursing academy; Yano, 18, who has graduated from senior high school; Sira, 14, in the 2nd grade of elementary school, and Inda, who is 3 years old.

Yane owns a kiosk business, selling daily needs products like cooking oil, sugar, coffee, soap, etc. In her spare time, Yane sews tablecloths, window and door curtains and then sells them. Recently, she had to pay her daughter education fees for the new semester registration. 

Unfortunately, now she cannot restock her kiosk business as she has spent all the money for her daughter’s education.Yane has requested a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000 from TLM to complete stocking her kiosk and to pay Yano’s education fees to university.

loans.use: to purchase kiosk stock like cooking oil, milk and soap, etc. and to pay Yano’s education fees to the university.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay for training in basic cooking

loans.name: Ae

texts.en:
Ae, 31, is married to Esty, 25. They are blessed with two lovely children:  Jhon, one year old and Joana 1 month old. 

Ae is a musician. He is skillful in several instruments like guitar, keyboard, and saxophone. In order to generate money for his family, Ae provides private music courses at his house. 

As an eldest brother, Ae also assists his brother, Yeskiel, in paying his education fees. At the moment, Ae needs money to pay research fees for his brother's thesis and to buy a saxophone.

loans.use: to pay research fees for his brother's thesis and to buy a saxophone.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Imelda works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Imelda is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like paints, wood, etc. for the maintenance of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Imelda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like paints, wood, etc. for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Irein

texts.en:
Irein is 27 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Irein works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, soap, sugar, noodles, etc. in her general store. Irein has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Irein would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, soap, sugar, noodles, etc. for her general store.

loans.name: Sandra Lorena

texts.es:
Sandra, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de seguir invirtiendo en el trabajo de avon, ya que los créditos son una fuente generadora de ingresos para los comerciantes; este le permitirá comprar lociones, rolos, tintes, maquillajes, entre otros productos. 
El crédito anterior le permitió incrementar las ventas y asimismo aumentar la clientela por la buena mercadería que ella brinda; las circunstancias familiares no han cambiado y las condiciones económicas se mantienen.
texts.en: Sandra is requesting a new loan due to her need to continue investing in her work with Avon, since the loans are a source of income generation for business people. This will allow her to buy lotion, hair rollers and dye, makeup and other products. Her prior loan allowed her to increase her sales as well as increasing her clientele due to the good merchandise that she offers. Her family circumstances haven't changed and her economic condition has remained the same.

loans.use: to buy lotion, hair rollers and dye, and other products.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a welding shop business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years now.

She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her shop. In the future, Amina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her shop.

loans.name: Sarma

texts.en:
Sarma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years, and earns more income from a general store. She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her fishing business like paints and woods, etc. for her fishing boat. 

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her fishing business, like paints and wood, etc.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en: Juvy, a married mother of five children from Bien Unido, Bohol, has been engaged in the fishing business with her husband for more than 13 years now. This is their sole source of income. Juvy is requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the boat. Through this, her husband will be able to expand the catch they can sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the boat

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
This is Hilda, 41, a resident of Taguig, Philippines, married to Edison, a driver, and a mother to her children. She and the children manage her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Hilda operates a food stall selling snacks like banana cue, a popular snack food in the Philippines consisting of deep-fried bananas coated in caramelized brown sugar. Banana cue is made from Saba bananas, usually skewered on a bamboo stick, and sold on the streets. She is also a tricycle operator. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan to buy bananas, sugar, oil and gas.

Hilda hopes that her business will expand soon and dreams of having a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, sugar, oil, and the gas needed in her other business.

loans.name: Exequias

texts.es:
El señor Exequias es  una persona emprendedora,  honesto  y serio, vive con su esposa y sus 5 hijos  en una comunidad de Choluteca en la zona  sur de Honduras. 
Don Exequias su negocio es la venta  de refrescos y churros. El préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  refrescos y churros y así tener productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Don Exequias con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten tiene su negocio en una zona turística y le representa una ventaja porque vende más  con esto espera  mejorar un poco su  situación  económica  y la de su  familia. 
 Don exequias espera que  en unos 3 años  su negocio siga  creciendo y  consolidándose  para que se convierta en la más grande y  reconocido de la zona y seguir  apoyando a su familia y a sus  hijos para que terminen sus estudios y se conviertan en personas honestas  con principios y valores.



Choluteca, Honduras –   Abril  del   2013
texts.en:
Exequias is an enterprising, honest, and serious person.  He lives with his wife and their five children in a community in Choluteca in the southern part of Honduras.

Exequias has a business selling soft drinks and chips.  He needs the loan to buy soft drinks and chips.  This way he will have products to offer his customers.

Exequias hopes that sales in his business will increase because of the loan.  He has his business in a tourist area, which is an advantage because he sells more this way.  He hopes to improve a little his financial situation and that of his family.

Exequias hopes that in some three years his business will continue growing.  He hopes to consolidate it in order to become the biggest and most well-known in the area.  He hopes to continue supporting his family and his children.  He will do this so that his children will become honest people with principles and values.

Choluteca, Honduras – April 2013

loans.use: to buy chips and soft drinks for his business.

loans.name: Francisco Serrato Group

texts.es: Doña Sofía es originaria de una comunidad indígena Mazahua. Comenta que ella era parte de otro grupo pero que desgraciadamente una integrante quedo mal y ella hizo su propio grupo para poder pedir un crédito e invertirlo en su pequeño negocio. Dice que desde hace 3 años tiene un negocio en su casa de venta de dulces, refrescos, frituras y que en su casa tiene un puesto ya que por ahí viven muchos niños y para poder ganar algo de capital ella vende, dice que puso el negocio porque  su esposo ya esta grande y no le alcanza con lo que le da para la alimentación y porque con ella vive una nieta la cual estudia la secundaria y doña Sofi, como le llaman, le ayuda a pagar sus estudios. Es por eso que ella está pidiendo su crédito porque quiere surtir su negocio de dulces y frituras para que pueda tener ganancias y así ayudarle a su nieta a concluir su secundaria. Los otros tres integrantes del grupo se llaman Hortencia, Alicia y Martha ellas invertirán en la compra de dulces, refrescos, frituras, para la compra de artículos para tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en: Ms. Sofia is originally from of a native american community of the Mazahua. She says that she was a part of another entrepreneurial group, but unfortunately one of the members was unreliable, so she formed her own group to be able to ask for a credit and invest it in her small business. She says that for 3 years she has run a business from her home selling sweets, refreshments and fried foods. And because her house has a reputation because there are many children who live in her area and she can earn a little bit of money from what she sells. She says she started her business because her husband is a big man and she needs to be able to feed him more and also because she lives with her granddaughter who is in high school and Ms Sofia helps her pay for her school expenses. This is why she is asking for a credit, because she needs to stock her business with sweets and fried foods so she can earn more money and be able to help her granddaughter finish school. The other three members of the group are named Hortencia, Alicia and Martha and they will invest their credit in purchasing sweets, refreshments, fried food and to purchase grocery items for their grocery store.

loans.use: purchase sweets, fried foods and refreshments.

loans.name: Allah Joy

texts.en:
Allah Joy works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. She has been sustaining her business activities through her loans from NWTF. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further enhance her general store and her charcoal business. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like soap, sugar, milk, coffee, canned goods, etc. in her general store business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like soap, sugar, milk, coffee, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
As a married parent of twelve children, Demetria works hard to support her family. She has an ambulant dried fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and fishing. 

Demetria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF.  She is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 56 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children, who are in school. Lucia is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lucia has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF, to finance her business activity. She would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Yaneth María

texts.es:
Yaneth de 37 años, es madre de dos hijos menores de edad, se dedica a laborar como empleada del servicio en una casa de familia, actividad que complementa con la venta de postres y productos de panadería, con el fin de generar los ingresos para el sostenimiento y la educación de sus hijos. 
En la actualidad desea capacitarse en la elaboración de productos a base de quesos y calados, con el propósito de montar su propio negocio e independizarse; razones que la han motivado a solicitar un crédito ya que no cuenta con recursos propios para realizar dicha inversión. 
Sueña con tener una vivienda propia y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Yaneth is 37 years old, has two younger children and she currently works as a domestic laborer for a family, an activity that she complements with the sales of cakes and bakery goods; with the goal of making enough money to support herself and for the education of her children. Currently, she wants to get training for making items like cheeses and a type of bread called "calado" so she can open her own business and be self employed. The reason she wants to ask for this credit is that she doesn't have her own resources to invest in making a business. She dreams to have her own home one day and to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: get training for making cheeses and bread.

loans.name: Beverlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Beverlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. Beverlyn is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Beverlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 52 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. Edna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like soap, sugar, and other groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for 8 years. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like soap, sugar, and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 56 years old and widowed with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like sugar, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, etc. to sell.

She has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. Elizabeth has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like sugar, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es:
Pedro es originario del municipio de Pueblo Nuevo, Estelí, de oficio agricultor, casado tiene 2 hijos, con las edades de 24 y 23 años. El inicio sus actividades en hortaliza hace 3 años a la edad de 44 años, un amigo lo convenció de que cultivaran tomate les fue bien y desde entonces se dedica a esta actividad.
En su negocio lo apoyan sus hijos y su esposa. Su producto lo comercializa en Managua. Tiene otros ingresos provenientes de la venta de leche ya que cuenta con una vaca parida que le da leche. Le gustaría vender su producto a los supermercados porque le pagarían a un mejor precio su producto. Las expectativas que tiene de su negocio son ampliar el área de siembra y obtener buenos rendimiento y precio justo por el producto. El préstamo lo solicito para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes foliares y pesticidas para cultivar media manzana de tomate.
