En este ciclo le irá muy bien, ya que tiene asegurada la venta de la ropa que compre. Además agrega que lo que más le ha gustado de trabajar con Fondo Esperanza es el hecho de que la asesoren y aconsejen, y la seguridad que le entregan como institución.
texts.en: The community bank Arcoíris (Rainbow) is located in the Concepcíon VII region of Chile. The group's members have businesses such as a car wash, a cheese seller, an auto mechanic, a fish seller, a hairdresser, and a bakery. Our interviewee, Carolina, is located in the middle of the photo wearing a black jacket and smiling. She is next to a man in a yellow cap. She has a business selling new clothes. She travels to Santiago to buy in bulk. She began her business in a very particular way: when she was 17 years old, her father loaned her $1,000 and she traveled with her brother to Santiago to explore the city. She bought some things in the Patronato neighborhood and when she got home, she sold them all. This is how she began to go to Santiago and buy clothes to order. When she was 19, she stopped working because of the birth of her son. But, last year she began to sell clothes again. She tells us that the bad thing about this business is when she sells clothes to people that don't pay. This has been one of her biggest problems. So, when she came back to selling clothes, she decided to only buy for the people who place orders and pay without problems. In this local cycle, things are going very well as she has assured the sale of the clothes she buys. She adds that, what she has most liked about working with Fondo Esperanza is the fact that they give her advice and counsel and the security that they offer as an institution.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Farhiya

texts.en:
Farhiya is married to her husband, who is a driver, and they have five children, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.
Farhiya has operated a charcoal selling business for the past year, selling from home to her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.
With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es: Doña Matilde de 47 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maíz y sorgo desde hace 10 años, también cuando ha pasado la cosecha  se dedica  a vender tamales en las colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, vive con su esposo y sus  4  hijos de 18, 15, 12 y 10 años de edad, es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a su familia, doña Matilde esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar fertilizantes, semillas, abonos  y herramientas para su cultivo de maíz y sorgo para obtener mejores cosechas y darle a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: 47 year old Matilde works growing corn and sorghum and has been doing this for 10 years. When the harvest is over, she also works selling tamales in the settlements that are close to her home. She lives with her husband and her 4 children who are 18, 15, 12, and 10 years old. She is a hardworking person and very responsible about her household obligations. She has always been known for providing the best for her family. Matilde is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, seed, and tools for her corn and sorghum crops so that she can get better harvests and give her family what they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Wenceslao

texts.es: Wenceslao  es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa, el  se dedica a ser agricultor siembra maíz y maicillo también se dedica  a la pesca artesanal,  sus cosechas las vende en las comercios de compra-venta de granos básicos con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos  gastos de su hogar. Wenceslao desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso ha solicitado un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, entre otras cosas, para seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en: Wenceslao is a man who is very responsible about his household obligations and has always been known as a man who offers his family the best. He currently lives with his wife and he is a farmer who grows corn and sorghum and he is also engaged in fishing. He sells his harvests to the merchants who deal in staple crops. With the profit that he makes from his sales, he is able to cover some of his household expenses. Wenceslao wants to increase his sales and so he is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers among other things so that he can keep putting bread on the table every day.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seed, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Husniyya

texts.en:
Husniyya is 26 years old and a mother of 2 children. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband and daughters in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She has been raising seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 5 years. She chose this business because it is profitable and because there is always a high demand for fresh crops. People use fresh vegetables every day and include them in many national dishes, such as pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served at every family’s table in Azerbaijan and are often made into fresh punch.

Husniyya sells her crops at the Bilasuvar central bazaar. Her monthly income is 150 AZN. Her husband actively helps her to raise her crops.

As her products are in high demand, Husniyya wants to expand her business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover the market demand. For this purpose, she has applied for a loan in the amount of 1800 AZN. She will buy seeds and fertilizers with her loan funds. This will be her third loan and she has a positive loan history.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to grow more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Chokumirira Hapana Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 41-year-old Judith from Masvingo. She is a single mother with three children; all of them are attending school. She also cares for four dependents. Judith runs a clothing business which sells dresses, shoes, jeans and t-shirts. The business has been in operation for 14 years. She says the main challenge she is facing is that her goods are sometimes stolen from her site during the night. Judith has requested a loan of $500 to buy dresses, jeans, shoes and t-shirts. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable her to pay up the school fees for all her children and also to improve the welfare of her family. In the future Judith plans to operate a transport business.

loans.use: to buy dresses, shoes, t-shirts and jeans.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with five children, all of whom attend school. She is also looking after her mother.
She has been operating a retail shop for fifteen years, working seven days a week. She also practices farming for additional income.
She has requested for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her purchase sugar, cooking oil, flour, salt, rice, dry beans, groundnuts, peas, and soda for sale. Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dream is to be able to own a big wholesale shop. She joined MCDT because her friends told her about the relatively low interest on loans. She stays in her own house with access to electricity and no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, soap, salt, cooking oil, dry beans, groundnuts, peas, soda, flour and rice for her shop.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a married woman. She lives with her husband in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water.

She has operated a kiosk retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy jeans, shoes, dresses, and t-shirts.

loans.name: Neris Abidio

texts.es: Don neri de 47 años de edad  es muy amable y trabajador, vive con su familia en casa propia. El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela en la que siembra maíz y sorgo,  sus productos son de muy buena calidad y la parcela está ubicada en una zona de fácil acceso lo que es muy bueno para él porque le beneficia que sus clientes puedan llegar inmediatamente hasta el lugar.  Don neri  solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga, fertilizantes, semillas, abonos, etc.  para iniciar la siembra cuanto antes. Neri ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una  mejor calidad d vida
texts.en: 47 year old Neri is very friendly and hardworking. He lives with his family in their own house. He works very hard on his own land on which he grows corn and sorghum. His produce is very high quality and his land is located in an area with easy access which is very good for him because customers can go right to where he grows. Neri is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL so that he'll have the money he needs to buy agricultural supplies such as pesticides, fertilizers, seeds, etc, for the next crop he sows. Neri is eager to increase his sales in order to make a better income and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Gene

texts.en:
Gene is 54 years old and married with three children.

Gene is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Gene requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Gene has been farming rice and sugarcane for eight years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF, and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Active Traders Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Active Traders group from Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. They are petty-businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, in order to request a loan of 500,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their respective businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently, improve their living conditions. 

Kadiatu is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone, 25 years ago. She is married to a businessman, and the two have two children. She has been selling for two years now. She sells onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy more of the aforementioned items to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy onions, margi seasoning, salt, pepper, etc., to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Job

texts.en:
Job is a 55-year-old businessman from Matuu. He is a shoemaker, a business he has operated for the past three years. He also does tailoring to supplement his income. He is married to Ruth. Job earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his second business loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying a previous loan. He will use the loan to purchase a new motorcycle to start a motorcycle transport business. He will use the proceeds from the business to invest in his tailoring business. He hopes to have a well sustained family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to start a transport business

loans.name: Nazem

texts.en:
Nazem is an Iraqi client, who is 38 years old, married and has 5 children. Nazem is the sole provider for the family.
Nazem is a cowman and owns a small farm. At his farm, Nazem raises cows, milks them and prepares dairy products from that milk. He has been practicing this business since 2004 and has gained good experience in this field. Thanks to the fresh and good quality of his products, Nazem has become well-known in the market.
Nazem is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to buy a new cow in order to increase his productions. Nazem believes that this loan will change his current financial conditions and will grant him the ability to take a better care of his family.

loans.use: to buy a new cow to increase milk production.

loans.name: Faida

texts.en:
For the past years, she has operated a charcoal selling business and has sold cereals. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is high cost of transportation to her place of operation.
With the loan she is requesting of KES 30,000 she wants to purchase 20 bags of charcoal for resale and more cereals. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support granted.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bags of charcoal for resale and more cereals.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 14 years.

Mercedita requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like sardines, shampoo, diapers and other miscellaneous items.

In the future, Mercedita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like sardines, shampoo, diapers and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Don juan se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra maicillo y maiz y con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador vive con su esposa. Juan  esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, etc. ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Juan has been engaged in farming for several years.  He plants sorghum and corn and from the sales of his crops, he manages to pay his household expenses.  He is a responsible, honest, and hardworking man.  He lives with his wife.  Juan is requesting a loan to purchase inputs for his crops such as fertilizer, organic fertilizer, and seeds because what he is earning is not enough to cover these expenses.  In this way, he will have higher income and better financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase inputs such as seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide.

loans.name: Batkhishig

texts.en: Mr. Batkhishig, 39 years old, lives alone in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a guardian at a private business entity where his elder brother has the position of auditor. The ger he lives in has been flooded with rain water recently, and the materials used for building the ger, such as planks and felt, became badly deteriorated. He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase a five-walled Mongolian traditional ger. This five-walled ger is way better than his previous ger in comfort by providing more space and warmth by preserving heat, especially during the wintertime. He will use less coal for fuel and contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a five-walled Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling).

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar lives with her mother and brother in Artashat town, and jointly with them, runs a farm. Their farm currently includes 15 chickens; they also cultivate barley and grow apricot, plum, apple and pear trees. The gathered harvest is sold locally, and this agricultural income is the only one for Gohar and her family.

Despite her young age (35 years), Gohar has 11 years of experience in the agricultural field, and she runs her farm with great love and pleasure. Having no financial means for expanding her agricultural business, Gohar has decided to apply to SEF International for the loan. With the loan's help, Gohar will be able to purchase little chickens and forage for feeding them. This will enable Gohar and her family to expand their farming business and gather more income, which is very important for sustaining the family.

loans.use: to pay for little chickens and forage for feeding them.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, all of whom attend school. She does not look after any additional family members. She has been operating a retail shop from home for the last six years, working seven days a week. 

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings to enable her to purchase trays of eggs, sugar, rice, maize flour, soap, salt and crates of soda for sale. She has no other source of income. She joined MCDT because of the easy terms for joining. Her main challenges include limited capital. 

She would like to have a big shop stocked with all basic commodities and accumulate profits to buy land. She is renting a house with electricity and no piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice, maize flour, soap, salt and crates of soda.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
This is Letecia, 41, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Joel, a welder, and is a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Letecia operates a room rental business; it is rented on a monthly basis. She also has a variety store. She earns a minimum of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every month.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 40,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan for the repair and maintenance of her room for rent. She will also buy grocery products for her business.

Letecia dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the renovation of her rental apartment and to buy grocery items for her variety store.

loans.name: Adam

texts.en:
Adam is 22 years old and from Gaza. He has owned a clothing shop for selling clothes since 2009.

He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a glass door and enlarge the space of his clothing shop. This loan will help Adam display more clothes and thus, increase his sales and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a glass door and enlarge the space of his clothing shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy spare parts for selling at a profit.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 37 years old. She has been running a retail shop for the past 12 years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 that she uses to support her family. She is applying for her second loan after repaying her previous loans successfully. 

She will use the loan to purchase sugar, rice, tissue papers, sweets, green grams, etc., for her retail shop. She intends to plough back the income earned from her business to start a new business. Her hopes and dreams are to own her own wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, tissue papers, sweets, green grams.

loans.name: Benta

texts.en:
Benta is married and has five children, two of whom attend school while three graduated from school and are working. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past one year, she has operated a dried fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she also does farming, which earns her another source of livelihood. 

She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of becoming a major supplier of dried fish in the near future.

With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase two sacks of dried fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Akuegnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AKUEGNON est composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Jeannette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Jeannette est âgée de 31 ans. Jeannette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Jeannette est mariée à un certain Pascal. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Jeannette vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. Pour ce faire, Jeannette vend de la bouillie, des beignets (à base de blé) et des crevettes de façon ambulante depuis quinze ans. Jeannette s’approvisionne dans un un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Jeannette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AKUEGNON, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The "Akuegnon" group comprises four people who live in the same area. The group leader, Jeannette, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. Jeannette is 31 years old and did not attend school. She is married to a man named Pascal. The couple have four children, all in school and in the care of their parents. Jeannette lives with her husband and children. The couple provide for the family together. In order to do this, Jeannette has sold bouillie (a cereal-based dish), beignets (made of wheat), and shrimp door-to-door for fifteen years. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. With the goal of satisfying her clientele and increasing her sales volume and income, Jeannette is seeking a fourth loan with ALIDÉ, along with the other members of the Akuegnon group. The previous loans were repaid properly.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, vegetable oil, and shrimp

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en:
Kasifa  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children and all of them attend school. She is also looking after two of her sisters. She stays with her husband in a rented house with access to electricity but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

She has been selling green bananas from the market at retail for 1 1/2 years, working six days a week. She also sells vegetables like tomatoes as another source of income.

She has requested a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more bunches of green bananas. 

Her challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her dream is to acquire a truck to help her in the transportation of green bananas from the farms, and also to build her own house  

She joined MCDT because she did not have capital to start a meaningful business.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Qiniso

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 32-year-old Qiniso from Bulawayo. She is single and has two children, one attending school.  

Qiniso runs a retail business selling clothes and footwear for both children and adults. The business has been in operation for four years. She says the main challenges are lack of working capital and competition from larger retailers. 

Qiniso has requested a loan of $500 to purchase more stock for the coming winter season. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to pay school fees and cover other household expenses. In the future Qiniso plans to open a boutique.

loans.use: to purchase more trading stock.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is married and has children who all attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past years, he has owned a retail shop business, where neighbors and town dwellers are his potential customers. He faces a major challenge of fluctuations in number of clients leading to the loss of perishable goods.

With the KES 30,000, he wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat. He dreams of expanding the business to a modern café. He again gives thanks to Yehu and Kiva for the help.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Sarvinoz

texts.en: Sarvinoz is 24 years old. She is married and has one child. She wants to provide her child with a good quality of life. Two months ago, Sarvinoz started a new animal husbandry business as she lives in a village and has some experience with animal husbandry. Sarvinoz completed the course "To Get Ahead" for women starting organizations and learned enough business skills. Her husband will help her with the business. She will be a very successful businesswoman as she is hardworking and smart. Sarvinoz requests a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy cattle to develop her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Akovognon

texts.fr: Akovognon est âgé de 38 ans et est marié à une coiffeuse du nom de Émilienne. Le couple a trois enfants dont certains sont scolarisés. Akovognon vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Akovognon et sa femme assurent ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Akovognon n’a pas fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la couture. En vue de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Akovognon sollicite pour la deuxième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Le crédit antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Akovognon is 38 years old and married to a hairstylist named Émilienne. The couple have three children, some of whom attend school. Akovognon lives together with his wife and children. He and his wife provide for the family together. Akovognon did not attend school, but learned how to make clothes. With the goal of satisfying the demands of his clientele, he is seeking financial support from ALIDÉ for the second time. The previous loan was repaid properly.

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies and an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Laxon

texts.en:
Laxon is married and has one child, who attends school. His wife, Mary, is a housewife and she contributes to meet the family's basic needs.

Laxon has operated a mechanics business for the past five years. His neighbors and other motor vehicles owners are his potential clients. In addition, he also operates a food selling business, which brings him another source of livelihood. 

With the loan of KES 20,000 he is requesting, he wants to purchase spare parts for his business to meet his customers' demands. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his business.
